Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a Family: Lots or Room and Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LeoAlberta
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently to Vancouver to visit family and friends; we have stayed at many different places. We will definitely be going back to the Cascadia. The room was large with two queen beds, a seating area with couch, desk and TV and a kitchenette with a small fridge and stove. There was also a large closet in the room. This room was much bigger than a standard room. It was clean and quiet. The bathroom and kitchenette were dated but this kind of thing doesn't bother us. We got a special package which included parking which is quite a bonus for downtown Vancouver. The front desk was friendly but understaffed and I needed to wait two times for more than 5 minutes to be helped. The breakfast was very satisfying and huge in a nice dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: RoyalBarb
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for? We had a great view, comfortable bed, convenient kitchenette and adequate sitting area with couch, TV and desk. Complementary breakfast was better than most hotels and definitely a bonus in our package which also included Starbucks coupons, free parking, free wifi and more. We especially liked the fact that once we parked our car for the weekend, we didn't have to take it out again, everything we needed was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast in Town”
Reviews.Author: 3skippingtown
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here with our 9 year old daughters for 4 days while we toured the area. The complimentary breakfast is unbelievable. They have EVERYthing, from bagels to eggs and pancackes, fresh fruit, hot coffee, cold cereal, yogurt. The BEST. It is nicely located and within walking distance of shops and restaurants. There is parking in the hotel basement, which is a little tight and expensive. Our room was clean and spacious with floor to ceiling windows and a kitchenette with refrigerator, sink, microwave, stove top and coffee maker. The price was affordable for downtown Vancouver and the location and breakfast made it perfect for us. I'll be back with my daughter and husband . . . SOON.

Reviews.Title: “Dont leave early”
Reviews.Author: sandgropers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the city of Vancouver for a night as we were taking the Rocky Mountaineer early the next morning which left from a more expensive hotel nearby. Breakfast is included in your tariff at the Cascadia but if you leave early they don't give you a breakfast basket the night before to use next morning, you just miss out. The room had a kitchenette so this would have been a good option. Room was very clean and we had an upgrade to a higher room. Lovely view. Very central location with transport very close.

Reviews.Title: “High End Stay”
Reviews.Author: sandilong1511
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the reburbised (ing) Cascadia July 2011. Great location close to Down Town and close enough to walk to the water front. I walked to the Canada Centre at the sea wall and hired a bike and did Stanley Park in 3 hours so no issues with location. Breakfasts were good but you gotta time your grab cos there are some busy slots but no complaint about the food. The rooms are very good. I was there on a 4 day business trip and it was perfect. Bed comfy, plenty of room to scope the net (free) and a balconey with a view. Yeah there was some construction going on but not at night so I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but in renovation”
Reviews.Author: BLKA
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious room. Friendly staff. Somewhat noisy due to the air/fan system difficult to control. Excellent breakfast. Loved that you could open the windows, in that kind of building. During the renovation, the pool they give you access to is a 15 min walk. So not a very interesting proposition at the end of a long day of walking when you want to use the pool. They were working on building a beautiful terrace, I'm sure it will be a nice relaxing spot once completed. The front desk should know how much their own laundry machines cost. I asked for change and she gave some change but it was the wrong coins. Had to go back again and exchange for other coins. Good value & location for Vancouver, but would probably try and test another location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Cascadia, we really don't understand how people cound be unhappy with this hotel. It has a great location, about a ten minute walk to the downtown, Davie st (gay village) on the doorstep which has some great bars and restaurants (if you like malaysian try the banana leaf restaurant) The trolley (red loop) stops right outside the hotel and the reception will sell a reduced price 2 day hop on hop off ticket. The Blue loop trolley stops one block behind the hotel and the ferry to granville island goes from the bottom of hornby st and is only $2. The rooms are spacious and comfy, yes the furniture is a bit dated but for a city centre hotel this place is a steal, plus the complimentary breakfast is a big bonus, good choice of hot and cold breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cascadia on 6-9 September before boarding the cruise ship, On arrival we were given a room on the 4th floor facing the back of the hotel. Because of the ongoing construction we asked to be given another room. We moved to the 12th floor facing the street. Even with window open the street noise was minimal. The front desk staff was very helpful. The room with kitchenette was more than adequate. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful. We were able to use the indoor swimming pool, jacuzzi and the gift certificates for Starbucks and Subway. We will definitely stay at the Cascadia next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Complimentary Buffet Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ranmor23
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 5 hotels on this trip to CanadaThis hotel provided the best value for money.Furniture was a bit dated but clean and good sized room with comfortable beds Breakfast was a great added bonus.Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Mangnall
Reviews.Content: The Cascadia is a Suite Hotel and everything you could want is in your room already. We had a huge bed, massive TV, sofa, and a desk for a laptop with wireless and wired internet access included in the price. The kitchen had a cooker, washing machine, dishwasher, fridge, coffee maker, kettle, toaster and all the cutlery, crockery and glassware you would need. With all of that we could live off the food from the many high quality deli's [and wine stores] in the city centre. High-speed lifts were available, and these were much used as our room was on the 19th floor with spectacular views across the city, and a great bar is also down there for you on the ground floor. Would we stay there again ? Absolutely, without a doubt, this place made our stay in Vancouver even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnighter in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: shastaball
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay in Vancouver as we passed through. Comfort Inn, Best Western all around $200 and looked pretty shady. Reviews on Cascadia were pretty good with similar price. Cascadia won because the RockyMountaineer picks up right here and the rooms were suites. We weren't disappointed. The decor is 80's but relatively clean and pretty spacious. The 'relative' term comes from the caked on dirt around the baseboards and tile in the bathroom and the kitchenette. It's not filthy, but looks like 20 years of daily cleaning without detailed scrubbing. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. A really, really good selection. The warm items were served steam table style, but were relatively fresh and all but the sausage was warm to hot. Good selection of breads, pastries, cereal, drinks and fruit. We also got a free $10 starbux and subway giftcard. Had I known better I would have stayed here on our way back out of town insteand of the highly overpriced and very disappointing Fairmont Pac Rim (see my review on that). Overall, I found Cascadia in need of some remodeling and deep cleaning, but would absolutely stay again. For what I paid and the service/opulence I received I've rated this higher than I did the aforementioned Fairmont. I would visit Cascadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Beakfast”
Reviews.Author: arthururm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in August, & the renovation was finished but they were taking down the scaffolding. No problems checking in. Close to everything. Good clean rooms & get better the higher you go. Jar of sweets in the room was a nice touch. All you can eat breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Construction is over, enjoy”
Reviews.Author: british_eh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during their construction, and it really wasn't an issue. I am surprised that people complained so much about it. Why are you in your hotel room during the day? I spent the mornings there and then was out till 1800 hours. It is 1 block away from Tim Hortons and I'm sure a Starbucks is nearby. I researched the area and within 10 minutes of walking there is a very good selection of restaurants, cafe's, and bars. Public transport too is nearby with the Canada Line translink only 6 blocks away. A bonus is that you can prep meals as there is a kitchenette, which is ideal for families/snacks. The self serve breakfast is the best I have had in any hotel! No problem leaving my bags for a pickup later, after I had checked out. Cheers, British_eh

Reviews.Title: “Very central with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: nhhughes
Reviews.Content: Although there were renovations going on during our week stay, it did not affect us at all. The hotel is in a great location for exploring downtown Vancouver. The room was clean and the bed was really comfy. We were on the 18th floor and the view was amazing. Having free high-speed internet in the room was great too. The staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all we were very happy during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: debbie506
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. The free breakfast was awesome - way beyond a continental breakfast. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub, too. Room included a small kitchenette (which we didn't actually use much as there are so many fantastic places to eat in Vancouver). Comfy beds. Courteous, friendly staff. Not a luxury hotel, but certainly above average. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: StephenJill
Reviews.Content: Our room was big and had a kitchette. Building works had just been completed and there was still hoarding at the front, but it was not a problem. Breakfast was included and the choice was good. The hotel is close to the gay district which is good if that's your scene and not a problem at all if it's not. The central shopping area is 4 or 5 blocks away. All things considered, it was a good base at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “It'll be a great hotel once the renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: OttawaAli
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the hotel in May of this year as part of vacation to Vancouver. The hotel location is excellent, being almost in the centre of the downtown area and within walking distance of most of the major attractions. The King bed room was a decent size, with a large kitchen area, desk with a chair, large sofa and a medium sized bathroom. The room was comfortable and clean, although the kitchen did feel slightly dated and the air conditioning unit was slightly noisy. Service was good with staff being friendly and helpful. Free Wi-fi is available throughout the hotel (ask reception for the password). There was a free buffet breakfast in the morning with a good selection of food (including hot items such as scrambled eggs) and there were plenty of tables to sit at. One downside was that I stayed at the hotel during its extensive renovations. Whilst I knew about these before booking I would advise staying away from the hotel until they are complete. Large pieces of fabric blocked the windows (and thus the view) and workmen were working very close to my room a lot of the time, (on a few occasions rubble fell onto my balcony, although there are notices in the room asking not to use the balcony so I was in no danger). The work was noisy and dusty and during weekdays started early making a lie-in impossible. Workmen were also working in the room next to mine which meant staying in the room during the day was almost impossible. Once the workmen disappeared everything was fine. The swimming pool and gym area were out of action during my stay (although arrangements were made to allow guests to use facilities 10 minutes walk away). Once all the work is complete the hotel will be a great place to stay. The price is reasonable for the location and the full kitchens are a bonus. Whilst I appreciate the need to keep the hotel open during the renovations and the need to make them, it does seem a bit of a cheek charging the usual price for what is currently a sub-par experience. Bad points - Dated kitchen area. Elevators rides are jerky and not very smooth, can feel like a thrill ride on occasions! Good points - Great location for downtown, within walking distance of most things, large rooms and full kitchen areas. Breakfast buffet has nice selection and is included free. Free Wi-fi. Tips - There is a 7/11 just across from the hotel for snacks, with larger supermarkets a few blocks away. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Skytrain (Vancouver City Centre or Yaletown - both on the Canada line). Fares from the airport require an extra add-on free, fares to the airport are the standard two-zone fee.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Wanda628
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vancouver and we chose this hotel because of the great web special. The hotel was in a great, convenient location, the staff were extremely personable and the room/suite was absolutely fantastic! We had a suite with a kitchenette, so the room was a large size with a large bathroom. The room was very clean. We did have an incident in the parking garage with someone breaking into our car and trying to steal luggage, but a hotel staff member ran after the thief (didn't catch him), called the police, filed a report, and cleaned up the glass from the broken window. They went above and beyond!! We would definitely stay here again....fantastic all the way around!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Seizedday33
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience overall. The rooms look like they used to be apartments as they included fridge, sink and microwave. Great location to West End restaurants and also Granville restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and rooms, great buffet!”
Reviews.Author: SharperView
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in downtown Vancouver, and you don't mind a 5-minute walk to the water, the Cascadia is amazing. Hornby Street is surrounded by restaurants, shopping, Stanley Park and the wonderful Granville Island, where we spent much of our time. Every room comes with a kitchenette and our comfy two-queen suite did not disappoint. The loaded breakfast buffet is complimentary and was delicious. We booked online and got a great rate and free parking. But even better, during a very unfortunate incident, the hotel staff gets a huge thumbs up for handling a police matter. Our rental car was parked on the lowest level and some idiot decided to do smash and grabs. The would-be thief smashed the driver's side window, and the security guard heard it and chased the man two long blocks before he escaped on a bus. While we were out whale watching, the staff cleaned up the glass, carried the suitcase that was on the backseat upstairs for safe keeping and handled the police report. They were very apologetic and took care of everything. Lesson to every visitor downtown - hide valuables well or bring them with you. The locals apparently know this. But all things considered, we were very happy with our stay and how the staff responded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just about 2 blocks from the Vancouver Seawall which allows you to walk all the way around the beachy area to Stanley Park. A few blocks in the other direction finds you in Yaletown and a little further to shopping on Robson Street. It makes a weekend in Vancouver very walkable - we had our car but didn't use it at all. The hotel staff is extremely friendly, from the front desk to the housekeeping and breakfast staff. As others have mentioned, the included breakfast is quite expansive with lots of choices. We left a clothing item in the room - I had called but housekeeping didn't find it. I received the usual post-stay email thanking me and asking for any feedback. I wrote to say that we had a nice stay but were disappointed that the clothing item didn't turn up, as we were absolutely certain we left it in the room. The General Manager responded very quickly and copied the front desk and housekeeping managers - in the end they found the item mixed in with the laundry service and shipped it back to me! The room was a bit smaller than I had expected - we had a "suite" with two queen beds. It is more like a large hotel room with a kitchenette along one wall and a couch added (there was a desk but no table/chairs for eating). Not all of the couches have a pull-out mattress so you might want to double-check if you are counting on that! I thought the rates were a bit high (US$225), but it was a celebration weekend with a large fireworks show and the finish line for a big bicycle race so that could have impacted it. It seemed to be a favored choice for international travelers - lots of different accents around! Overall, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, only breakfast no other dining or Bar”
Reviews.Author: single-dad-glos
Reviews.Content: Had an upgrade to an apartment which was good. lack of lifts and staff override so can wait a long time

Reviews.Title: “WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kendra k
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 night night stay with the hotel online and received our confirmation email with the grand total for our stay . Thinking everything was settled. The night before we were to check in I called the hotel to confirm my reservation. The price had now changed and they wanted an extra $270!!!!!!!! How can a price change after a confirmed reservation???????? I spoke the front desk and on duty supervisor 4 times within an hour. I always having to call them to find out what's going on. They blamed the extra charges on the online booking site and told me that I 100% had to pay the extra money upon checking in and offered no resolution. How can a hotel advertise online, attracting guests to then change the price upon arrival??? I cancelled my reservation as I couldn't be paid to stay in hotel like that!!!!! If your looking for a hotel that will laugh at you on the phone when your upset and say :why are you upset" and offer you no choice but to pay their extra charges, then stay here!!!! I give the Cascadia a 0 out of 5. Awful awful awful hotel!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: travelingEA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights. It was in the best location for us only 4 blocks away from the sea wall and granville isle. We were able to walk from one end of the city to the other. You do not need a car, the transportation in the city is great. The trolley for sightseeing stopped right outside the hotel. If you like to ride bikes they have great bike paths. The breakfasts were great. We will definitely return again Tip -when taking sky train from airport into town it has a surcharge of $5.00 plus zone price . The city is divided into zones, zone 1 - $2.25, zone two $3.75 and so forth. You can find what zone you are going to on the ticket machine.We paid $8.75 pp to get into centre of town from airport.When going out to airport you only pay zone price.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SteveC1970
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel in the evening and was quickly greeted by friendly staff, and check-in was fairly quick. I got to my room and noticed that the dishwasher was running... since I had no idea how long it had been running, I contacted the front desk and they offered me a new room. The room itself was comfortable and spacious. There was a kitchenette with a stove, fridge and dishwasher. (I had their decent breakfast buffet every morning and I ate out for lunch and dinner, so I never used the kitchenette.) The bed and bathroom were comfy and clean. I was on a lower floor, so the view was still obstructed by scaffolding, so as a tip, request a room on an upper floor if you're going to be staying in the near future. Great location -- downtown Vancouver is not that big, so basically anywhere is walking distance, but since a big reason I was there was to visit the Davie Village, the location was fantastic. Check-out was extremely quick... all it took was a quick call to the front desk and check-out was completed -- I just left the keys in the room and walked out the front door. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value useful location”
Reviews.Author: JayceeSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first stop on a two week visit to Western Canada. Slightly disappointing at first that the hotel was STILL covered in scaffold even thougth renovations were supposed to have been completed 2 months earlier, so no view whatsoever from our room. However this hotel is not in the area to get the Best views of the Harbour so not a real problem if you want a view dont go for this hotel. However its location is good, it is a short walk to False Creek and theGranville island Ferry, and Hornby Street has direct access up to the main downtown area. There are many restaurant, bars, cinemas within walking distance from the hotel, a useful 7/11 across the road. The family room was large with well equiped kitchen area, and seating area. Beds very comfortable .The FREE buffet breakfast is excellent and plentiful. The restaurant area very clean and well run, all items constantly being replaced. The pool is small but so are most hotel pools, there is a jacuzzi which is reasonably sized. Good guest laundry self service. the staff were helpful , efficient and pleasant. We asked to change rooms on arrival and our request granted immediately. We got a deal on free parking which is very helpful in a city which has expensive parking, but we did find having a car very useful . In PArticular to get to the North Shore and to drive to Stanley PArk to then hire bikes. For Bike Hire use BAyshore Rentals as they have free parking for customers adjacent to their shop will save you loads, particularly during the week. PArking at the Weekend in Vancouver is easy and cheaper in one of the many multi story carparks "Easy PArk" What a great city and a very useful place to stay . It is not the most "glamourous" of hotels but it doesnt pretend to be. It is efficient, very comfortable and a great place for a family to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better quality and better service than more expensive hotels in same area of town”
Reviews.Author: Herb053
Reviews.Content: Due to a medical emergency, I walked in off the street with no reservation and they bent over backwards to help me out. I found the hotel to be the best hotel I have ever stayed in.(I am in my sixties and have stayed in many over the years) The price was very reasonable, the room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and everything in the room worked.(that is something I have rarely experienced before). As far as I am concerned this is the first place I will come to if I need a hotel room in Vancouver in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Juno1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced, staff was quite helpful, and location is fantastic. The hotel is located in Davie Village downtown near the corner of Hornby and Davie. It's walking distance to the seawall leading to Stanley Park, to the water taxi to go to Granville Island, to shopping on Robson, and Kitsilano is just over the Burrard bridge. The kitchenette is fully stocked and clean. The free breakfast is good. I was lucky enough to get a room near the top of the hotel and so avoided the scaffolding, had a great view of the ocean and mountains. Can't beat the price in downtown Vancouver. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: ILMD
Reviews.Content: We spent a very enjoyable 3 nights in this hotel. The room was very nice and spacious with 2 queen beds and small kitchen area. Although renovations were still going on this did not affect our stay as our room was on the side of the hotel which was already finished. Excellent complimentary buffet breakfast with a selection of hot and cold food. Hotel is in perfect location for visiting Stanley Park and taking the aquabus to Granville Island. Lots of restaurants to choose from nearby. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: folkcougar
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 nights at Cascadia. I was visiting Canada and my husband and I wanted a short break in the city which included his birthday, so this was a special trip for us. We wanted to be together in a cosy rather than posh place where we could feel relaxed and eat 'at home' if we wanted to just be together. Cascadia was the perfect choice! We had a Deluxe suite on the 15th floor with a balcony and view over the mountains and inlet. The location is excellent - just a short walk down the road gets you to the aquabus to Granville Island and the nearby streets are full of shops and places to eat. The room was spacious, immaculately clean and everything was provided in the super little kitchen, even a dishwasher! We didn't eat out but bought fresh produce and amazing pasta from Granville Island market and ate overlooking the view from the balcony. The bathroom was also immaculate, well-appointed, loads of towels for two and the toiletries were lovely - so nice I asked for some of the soap to take home with me and they gave me some without charge, which was very kind. There was free parking and free internet access, both useful and money saving. Breakfast was a buffet and I have to say the nicest I have had - so many choices of juice, fruits, fresh baking, lovely cereals and parfaits, a continuous toaster to make fresh hot toasted bagels, toast or muffins and also a hot selection which changed the next day but included sausages, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes and waffles. All in a large, well-appointed dining room. The staff were very efficient at replenishing the food choices and clearing away vacated tables and the atmosphere was relaxed not hurried. Breakfast is also served over a long period so that clearly makes this work very well. The staff were so helpful, polite and friendly without being intrusive. There were renovations going on, but they did not intrude on us at all as the scaffolding was below our floor anyway, but there was no noise or dust. If I had wanted to use the pool, I might have been a little put off by being observed by builders but that was a very minor consideration! We were also right next to the lift but there was also no noise from that whatsoever. The work to renovate this hotel building is well worth it because we think they have got everything else that they do so right. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Aymeric
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cascadia once before in Aug. 2010 and finding it more than adequate for a longish stay - i.e. a week - rebooked last spring, as a base while house-hunting. On the edge of trendy Yaletown, the hotel is within easy walking of mostly everything, with a Canada Line - direct from YVR - just few blocks away along Davie St. and convenient bus routes at hand. The building exterior was still draped in renovation covering, meaning some light/view loss, but did not really detract from the main advantages of the roomy studio suite, with full kitchen facilities. Sure, room decor and TV are mainly of another age, but all was kept clean - for me, the main point. Very friendly staff, complimentary newspapers and breakfast (excellent choice of items, all enhanced by gas log fireplaces and pleasant outdoor patio), handy internet terminals in lobby. Maybe the hotel restaurant/bar has reopened, though there's certainly no shortage of spots close by. I can't really think of anything significantly negative to report, and for my purposes, especially given the deal via the hotel website, absolutely no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Very good downtown hotel with complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Brocks
Reviews.Content: On 2 occasions recently we stayed at the Cascadia hotel. My husband was on business and I tagged along. It has undergone some exterior renovations and now the interior is being done but, in no way did this cause us any problems. The cost was very reasonable but, I imagine after the renovations, they might increase. The rooms are large with a kitchen and separate sitting area. The complimentary breakfast consists of both hot and cold selections and is quite satisfactory. The hotel is situated at the lower end of Hornby St at Davie. If you turn left as you leave the hotel, the street ends at a ferry stop where you can take a 5 min trip across to Granville Island. if you turn right it is a short walk to Robson St and the downtown area. We also really enjoy busy Davie St which is full of interesting stores and restaurants. Vancouver is a lovely city, very walkable, lots to see and always in easy reach of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great breakfast, but...”
Reviews.Author: BellinghamSojourner
Reviews.Content: This is a pricey but lovely hotel, very modern and well-located on a quiet street just one block from bustling Burrard. Construction continues, and the pool/fitness center were unavailable during our stay (one reason we had chosen this hotel) and when we let the front desk know about it, there was no offer of a discount or other compensation. Breakfast was the best, most comprehensive I've seen in a hotel--eggs, bacon, pancakes, french toast, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal--so that is worth a lot. The room was very modern and beautiful with a small kitchenette. Parking was a hefty $20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “In the dark......for 5 days”
Reviews.Author: MiMinomad
Reviews.Content: Couldn't open the curtains for the 5 day stay due to workmen on the balcony therefore a very gloomy stay. Very disappointed with pool and gym out of action when expectation on booking earlier this year was that this would be unaffected. Staff courteous and helpful. Loved the printer and wifi access in the foyer. Breakfast a bonus. Rooms tired and in need of a renovation but extremely spacious. Would try this hotel again once renovations completed but until then,at the price, would try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “renos aren't enough...”
Reviews.Author: polish_in_edmonton
Reviews.Content: honestly... this place shouldn't be renovated. it should be torn down and rebuilt. what good is it that you do renos on the outside to make it look pretty on the street, where the inside looks 1970ish.. it just looks gloomy. not fresh at all. sure location is nice, but do you really want to be dreading going back to the hotel every night?

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Madge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 15th to 22nd June.We were on a 7 day city break to Vancouver.Rooms were large and comfortable and staff polite and helpful.We were warned about the renovation work by our travel agent before our departure but it did not affect us as we were out sightseeing for most of our visit.Hotel is within walking distance of all the tourist thing to do in Vancouver.Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying on a budget as it was great value for the money we paid for our week.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tomtom12
Reviews.Content: On arrival we drew back the drapes only to see a workman, in a helmet, on his hands and knees, looking straight at us. This was particularly upsetting as our booking agents had called us to say that the work on the east wing had been completed and we would be allocated a room unaffected by the renovation work. Notwithstanding the initial disappointment, the strength of the hotel is it's location. Within walking distance of the ferry to Granville Island, well worth a visit; Davey Street village, with a choice of every type of restaurant that you can think of; and Robson Street if you like to shop. Despite the droning of pneumatic drills, our room was comfortable, with a kitchen area and sofa, albeit too soft to be comfotable, and a desk/work station with high speed internet access. We found the breakfast to be very average compared with those we had experienced other hotels on our trip from Calgary through the Rockies to Vancouver. Be warned that although they say parking is $19/ night they add on the tax when they give you the bill. UK guests will find this practice particularly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: GotnoSpice
Reviews.Content: A lot of people on TA were complaining about the hotel because of the renovations on the outside. Obviously this is something that needs to be done at certain point in a hotels history. They did a great job of keeping it quiet during quiet hours. Also nothing was really disrupted except the view a little bit. It's going to be great once it's done. The breakfast was amazing, as well as the hotel staff were very helpful, even helping us ship stuff. And best of all the WiFi was not only free but very fast and reliable!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: JEREAUT
Reviews.Content: The hotel looed and felt very unkept. Our room smelt like a mixture of cleaning products and stale air. Also thought the hallways were dark and dirty. The parking was overpriced and scary.

Reviews.Title: “It was really comfortable. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: nittoToronto
Reviews.Content: Big room, comfortable beds, with small efficiency kitchen all very clean. Only issue was the bath room fan was very, very noisy so didn't use. Great friendly, polite service. Great location, just down Hornby were the AquaBuses. The hop on and off Trolley stopped right in front of the hotel. The hotel exterior was being renovated and couldn't use the pool because of same but it didn't intrude on our stay at all. Free internet was much appreciated. Overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Owly13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and did our best to limit the actual time spent in our room. The ongoing total renovation of the outside and many areas inside have been mentioned already by various other reviewers & it looks terrible from the outside & from the room. They have a peg on the curtains to keep them closed so that the workers can't see in. We asked what the arrangements were for a gym / pool and were told that the gym had been relocated to the 21st floor. We went up - OMG - it was a bedroom (which actually had a view without scaffolding or netting). It had one old treadmill, 1 old cross-trainer type thing & a load of free weights - that was the gym!!!! There was a very large private gym in the next street so why they couldn't arrange something there, I don't know. They gave us a voucher to go to the public swimming pool - we decided to pass on that one. We were not informed of the renovations prior to our arrival & have taken this up with the tour company who booked it for us but they aren't interested. The bedroom was quite big but the furniture old fashioned & in need of replacement. This is not a cheap hotel & therefore I would strongly advise against staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: marriemittens
Reviews.Content: No pool...no hot tub...no view...hotel under renovation and not told about conditions before check in. If management hides something so obvious what isn't seen and may be hiding under the covers???

Reviews.Title: “we had a fab time would use again”
Reviews.Author: jamiemcg4
Reviews.Content: very cental,staff could not have been more helpful,rooms were spacious and clean although could do with being updated. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Teresa01Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was listed as a comfortable extended stay, had a pool and spa, and a gorgeous view from out 19th floor room. We arrived at a hotel undergoing very, very extensive reconstruction, the pool and spa were shut down for renovations (and the 5-minute drive to an alternative pool was not an alternative on our schedule) and the "view" from our 19th floor room consisted of scaffolding, building materials and hard-hat wearing workmen climbing on the balcony at various unannounced times during the day. The constant drilling and hammering until 5pm was impossible. I thought that it was considerably rude not to inform us of these disruptive renovations beforehand and that the very reasons we chose this hotel (view/spa) were not available. An absolutely horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: sirloinlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before going on a cruise. We knew about the work being done to the hotel because we checked the hotel website beforehand. We figured that since the work was between 9 am and 5 pm it wouldn't matter, we'd be out sightseeing. Right: it did not bother us at all. Even opened our (10th floor) window to chat to the workman one morning - think it gave him a surprise!! Our room was huge: two king size beds, a large couch, desk, coffee table and kitchenette. Everything was spotless. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice, and you could eat as much as you wanted (to prepare you for a day of sightseeing). Laundry was good - we were able to wash our clothes before going on the ship. It was very central, handy for the buses. There is a cafe just round the corner; think it's called BG - does a FANTASTIC thai curry - and not dear either! Very comfortable hotel, I'd definitely come back! Free internet in lobby let us check our emails (we chose to delete the internet history afterwards - so nobody couldaccess ourdetails)

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE...UNDER RENO AND COMPLETELY DRAPED IN FABRIC”
Reviews.Author: robingino
Reviews.Content: I have been forced to stay here since my employer paid for my 5 week stay and even though it is free It is not worth the stay. The building is completely draped in a green fabric and all the balconies are sealed shut. The pool and hot tub are closed, the exercise room has been relocated to a hotel room and parking in the basement is a real hassle. The construction noise and endless concrete drilling is enough to force you to break the glass on the balcony and jump off the building. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO ELSEWHERE. I CALLED THE FRONT DESK THIS AFTERNOON AND THE TOLD ME THIS WILL GO ON AT LEAST TILL JUNE.

Reviews.Title: “Exceded my expectatations”
Reviews.Author: Fulkie
Reviews.Content: After a 21 day cruise from Miami to Vancouver, we were anxious to check into our hotel. We were a short taxi ride from the cruise terminal. We were welcomed upon our early arrival and givn a room .Even though the hotel was under renovations, (which we were informed about via email prior to the cruise) and again upon arrival, it did not disturb our visit in any way. The Hop On Hop Off bus stopped right in front of the hotel every 20 minutes, making our two days of sightseeing a pleasure. The help were really helpful, the breakfast plentiful and good and the room accomodations very satisfactory. I would never hesitate to recommend this place to others. I will definitely stay here again if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Facilities and staff!”
Reviews.Author: MChung88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last August with my girlfriends and will be staying here again in July with a larger group of girls. I cannot be more excited! With planning this new trip, I already know I can depend on the staff to help me navigate the city, as well as I still have the maps and directions the staff printed out for me last time. I also felt like the cleaning staff was always on top of their game, washing dishes i left out or putting away washed dishes (which I still kinda feel guilty for). As for the tv being dated, I'm not sure because i never watched it when i was there but i thoroughly enjoyed the nearby grocery store a few blocks up which the staff helped us find! We used the pool and gym, which i thought were well maintained and the breakfast was good too! Sometimes it was really busy, so i hope this time getting seating for 5 girls won't be too long of a wait. View was okay too, nothing to complain about. The only thing i would want different for this trip is the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Here's a good place to stop over when visiting Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: aggysmith
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel through Canadian Affair for trip from Britain I found it to be an excellent venue for visiting Vancouver. Whilst an earlier reviewer had mentioned the current revovations and scaffolding neither interfered with my stay here! {Ok, so your view might be restricted but I did not stay here to gaze out of the windows!] And it will be finished soon. The friendly staff were exemplary they knew the answers and ensured satisfaction The hotel suites with built in kitchens (fridges/dishwashers) were spacious, comfortable and very clean. Breakfasts are always fully satisfying when everything is at your fingertips and the food provided here was most satisfying. The staff here too were very good and cheerful. The hotel is not in the exact centre of Vancouver but is near enough to enable anyone to see the sights with ease and it's a friendly and beautiful city to wander round on foot or by touring 'trams'.

Reviews.Title: “Best pillows ever!”
Reviews.Author: FWDaisy
Reviews.Content: Reading prior reviews, I wonder how long this renovation has been going on? We had plastic over our windows, which was a shame because I think we had a view of the waterfront. Pool was closed, but we were offered a pass to a facility 5 blocks away if we wanted to swim. Uh, no thanks. Parking is $15 ( I think per day). The sleeping area of the room itself was nice. It had 2 comfortable beds, a couch and a kitchenette with a dishwasher! The water pressure in the shower was disappointing and the bathroom fan was very loud. The breakfast was good - lots of choices and the staff kept the eating area clean. We would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Dgomersall
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for 8 nights. Rooms were quite comfortable but a little outdated. They are doing some refurbishment works at the moment to the exterior of the hotel, but this is needed in the rooms too. Breakfast in the morning was pretty decent (very good pork sausages) and on the weekends they have a wafflemaker! Would have appreciated this waffle maker being out everyday! Didn't get to use the swimming pool as this too was undergoing work during our stay. All in all, its a good comfortable property for the traveller on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “How can anyone criticize this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: mike155032
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel we were welcome by a very friendly and helpful employee.Our stay was most pleasant and your hotel was chosen by the rocky mountaineer.Since we had chosen that trip for our 45th wedding anniversary ,we were presented by the hotel with a nice card congratulating us and were pleasantly surprise to see a nice basket of fruits on the last evening of our stay.A most pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised, good choice for a couple of nights.”
Reviews.Author: tigger_uk19
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here after reviewing others comments and due to the apparent value for money. We were pleasantly suprised, yes it looks a little tired, but the room was a good size with a mini kitchen area and was clean and comfortable. From our room we could even see the sea so it wasn't too bad a view either across the city! The only minor points are that the swimming pool was closed for renovations and I wasn't advised this until check in. Also one of the receptionists booked us a table for dinner at a local restaurant, however, when arriving there in the rain we discovered the place shut!! We made our way back to the hotel where they did apologise, well one member of staff did and helped us find somewhere else for us to go and then even paid for a taxi one way out to another restaurant! Now thats what I call an apology. Breakfast was pretty good and set you up for the day too. All in all a good choice for us and our sightseeing and somewhere we would return despite a couple of minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and I made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: craigyboy007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cascadia hotel from the 14th Dec 2010 to 21st Dec 2010.... Before I booked the Cascadia I spent about 4 hours reading hotel reviews for many different hotels in Vancouver and I just couldn't justify in spending another £500 for a 4 star or 5 star hotel... The Cascadia is a 3 star hotel so people shouldn't really moan about the decor being dated, to me it just looked like any normal hotel decor. My room was clean, nice size and everything worked and I had a great view from the 18th floor looking of the mountains. The breakfast was nice and I thought there was plenty of choice, toast, french toast, pancakes, yoghurts, cerials, etc everything was fresh and as usual staff very friendly... Talking of staff, I went to the front desk on the 15th Dec to get a safety deposit box and before I finished my room number , I think it was John-Paul Yu , already knew my name, my room number and also knew it was my birthday and wished me a Happy Birthday and I had a room upgrade :-) when I got back to my room in the evening, I had a birthday card and chocolates from the staff. Now, that's what I call service and it just made me feel that I was a valued guest! On leaving the hotel 21st December I had the option to check out a bit later due to the travel chaos back in the UK... I explained that I might need a room for a few more days if my flight get cancelled.. I was told that's not a problem and the staff have already been informed that I might need to stay for a extra few days and a special price would be sorted for me. I'm glad I didn't stay in another hotel and spend an additional £500 as I don't think I would have got this type of service... End of the day most people on sleep at a hotel and not spend all day in their rooms! I had no complaints or issues and would recommend the hotel to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “I WAS VERY PLEASED”
Reviews.Author: kodiyak
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous, overall a hotel that lived up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Col-and-Kim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made the Cascadia our base for a few days at the end of October on our honeymoon. The hotel was recommended to me by a work mate who had stayed here the year before. The overall look of the hotel is quite nice with a decent sized foyer. The room we had was a little small for my liking and a little dated as well, but it was still a very nice room. The room backed onto the elevator shafts so we did hear the ping of the elevator as it stopped on our floor. The location wasn’t too bad. We caught taxis to the more distant places and walked the rest. The bed was very comfortable and the internet was good, but it did slow dramatically when a lot of people were using it. It was WiFi which was handy for us as we were using our Ipod Touch’s for skyping back home. The full kitchen was well equipped but we didn’t use it. The buffet breakfast was pretty good and the dining room was a fair size. Unfortunately the pool was closed for maintenance during our stay but, the laundry was open and we put that to good use. We had room service the first night in the hotel (steak), it was very nice. We had a wonderful dinner in the restaurant downstairs on our last night in Vancouver. We were served by a lovely hostess, Alexi. The food was wonderful and later that same night we went back to the restaurant for hot chocolate and dessert which was equally lovely. Overall it is a very nice hotel with good staff. The room was a little small but the good restaurant and laundry room more than made up for that. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that aims to please: Great value/service/location/buffet”
Reviews.Author: marty1953
Reviews.Content: Every single interaction we had with the Cascadia hotel was positive. Due to remodeling, our room was a bit noisy. We were not only provided a room farther away from the noise, but the guest services supervisor (John-Paul Yu) left a large fruit/cheese tray in the room with a personal note apologizing for any inconvenience. We also left a jacket in our room, and staff again promptly and efficiently facilitated return of the item from Canada to the U.S. We had pleasant conversations with staff attending the buffet (which was varied and tasty). The hotel is centrally located for walking. We were more than satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: J_L_Edmonton2010
Reviews.Content: Despite ongoing renovations, the stay was very comfortable. Great value; buffet breakfast was convenient, tasty, and more than filled us up for the day. Within walking distance of all of downtown. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by friendliness and value”
Reviews.Author: CherishA
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Cascadia was a shot in the dark; I'd never heard of it before and booked on-line, trying to keep costs down. So, when we arrived to discover that we were getting a spotlessly clean and welcoming suite for about half the price of a room at many of the surrounding hotels, we were thrilled. Our first impression of the hotel's atmosphere came from Mike, at the front desk. He was awesome! Fun, easygoing, yet perfectly professional, making us feel instantly at home, he was helpful, informative and cheery, even though it wasn't his usual shift. Plus, there were perks :) My friend and I were very impressed with our experience and will definitely return to Cascadia, again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: leide59
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at this hotel. The service was good, the web price which included a fabulous buffet breakfast was a very good value, the rooms were very comfortable and had kitchenettes. The pool and hottub were out of commission due to renovations but an alternative was provided nearby for those that desired. The restaurant adjoined had good food for a reasonable price, though the service was a bit slow. My party of nine stayed in rooms around the eleventh floor, so traffic noise was not an issue. It was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The reason not to make a decision based solely on Trip Advisor's ratings.”
Reviews.Author: 8maya6
Reviews.Content: As I passed the Executive Inn Vintage Park I thought, "I cancelled THIS hotel" and as I drove up to the worn facade of the Cascadia Inn & Suites REGRET was the first word that came to mind. I decided to give it a chance as I had read the hotel had been renovated but upon entering (for lack of a better word) the 'used' room, I was sorely disappointed. The toilet looked like it had been burned and the lid wouldn't stay up. Also, there was a door to an adjoining room where you could hear a pin drop (now imagine how loud the screaming match was next door). There were not that many people staying in the hotel and we had booked in advance (even sent an e-mail to which we did not receive a response), you would think they could have offered us a decent room. They, also, did not refill the toiletries. Although the Executive was the same price as Cascadia, we cancelled it solely on the rating Cascadia had received (maybe it is because of the changeover from the Marriott Residence Inn not too long ago that it hasn't been reviewed as much ?). We had even considered booking the Best Western whose Hot Breakfast is, as a whole, good and has fresh fruit, doesn't have rubbery sausages, watery eggs (even the personnel put the toaster back to a higher setting directly after we adjusted it to not burn our next set of toast) and they were not as expensive as Cascadia. The Cascadia Inn & Suites internet site made breakfast look good as it did everything else. Again, we chose according to the TA ratings. During our stay the pool was closed (but there was no discount), the elevators weren't working one evening (we were on a higher floor), there wasn't any parking or stopping out front due to construction which you could hear very early in the morning and the absolute was that they shut off the water for a day (with a little notice in the elevator which I would normally not pay attention to) with no reimbursement. They offer a room with a kitchenette and they shut off the water, I am curious how the cleaning personnel cleaned the rooms that day. Anyways, we had just finished a whirlwind tour of North America and this was the only hotel that we had chosen because of the good ratings and this was by far the worst hotel we had encountered (we even kept getting locked out of our room because the keys were set for only one day). I have never written a review on Trip Advisor up until now but I felt it was important that people knew what they are getting themselves into (I wish I had paid attention to the warnings from other reviewers). So, if you care about the quality of the hotel and the services they offer, I would NOT recommend the Cascadia Inn & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at Cascadia”
Reviews.Author: Shrega
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't the fanciest, but the staff make up for it. GREAT free breakfast buffet. Loved the little kitchenette area - very helpful if you're staying more than a couple of days. Laundry room is downstairs. We did a load, and the dryer didn't work, and the staff offered to dry the clothes, fold them and deliver them the next day. Very helpful. Good location with parking underneath. Fitness center and pool was unfortunately closed at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location, great staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: africaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cascadia Hotel and Suites as part of a month long trip to Canada. The hotel is absolutely perfectly located and within walking distance to many of the attractions downtown. The staff were friendly and always eager to assist . We had our 1 year old son and it was a pleasure having the kitchenette and mini fridge with freezer. The staff were always offering to help with out little son and the breakfast staff fell over themselves to help us. The room was nice and big and comfy. We hired a car and drove from here to all locations in and around Vancouver and I can highly recommend the hotel for all types of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in lovely city”
Reviews.Author: KMKTraveller
Reviews.Content: Vancouver seems to be a pretty pricey city when it comes to accomodation, so finding a deal at Cascadia, which we did, can be described as a bargain I guess. The location is perfectly fine (albeit not completely central) and the standard room was huge, clean, with a nice view through large windows; Kind of luxurious. Breakfast was plentiful and we never had to wait for a table (it pays to show up before 9). The staff was very welcoming and kind and we took advantage of the indoor pool with jacuzzi. Our room was just nearby the elevators, ok they occasionally make a loud sound but that didn't bother us at all. Go see Vancouver, it's a lovely city and this hotel makes a great base.

Reviews.Title: “Cascadia is Fantasitic in every way - location, price and cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: SCSA_10
Reviews.Content: Close to shopping, bus route p/u and d/o is right there (#6 Bus), Yale Town right next door (two streets over), movie theater and great restaurants - We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Like to ride your bike around Stanley Park, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Warscots
Reviews.Content: Walk just outside the front door of the hotel is the bike that takes you over to the beginning of the seawall that goes around Stanley Park. You end up at English bay the just up the hill 3 blocks and you are back to the hotel. The breakfast was good too. Can't wait for better weather to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Suite with Bkfst & Service at Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisL52
Reviews.Content: This is great value for our room. We had 2 double beds, sofa and small kitchenette in downtown Vancouver. Room is clean and comfortable. Free wireless . There is a large assorted breakfast which is included in the room price. What is handy is the small kiosk in the lobby where you can print your boarding pass for most airlines. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & great beds!”
Reviews.Author: alyshiab
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at Cascadia in Vancouver was great (room 703). We had a great room with a kitchenette and full size couch sitting area. We weren't expecting this but it was great! The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were great too! The morning breakfast was "fine." Some warm items. It got a little boring by the 4th day (so we skipped it) but it was very adequate for a breakfast included in your hotel stay. The pool and fitness area is under construction and we did miss not being able to swim on-site. Although I'm sure when they get it up and running again it will raise the price of the room such that I wouldn't stay there anyway. In the "services binder" in your room there is a menu for GIGI'S.... DO NOT EAT THERE. We ordered delivery from them one night and were VERY unimpressed. Our two pasta dishes were almost inediable and it was WAY over priced. Stay away from Gigi's. Also, parking, at $19 a day/night is very steep. It is convienient and clean (although they say it's not very secure [signs everywhere about not leaving belongings in your car]) but I wasn't expecting to pay an extra $80 just to park. Had I known this I might have stayed in a hotel with parking included. I found this unreasonable. Otherwise, our room was great. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, the Penthouse Suite is highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: fionadavid91
Reviews.Content: We finished our Rocky Mountaineer 25th wedding anniversary tour in the Penthouse Suite and it was the perfect end to a wonderful trip. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, the breakfast was delicious and plentiful and the views over the city were breathtaking. Can't wait for our 50th!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the free breakfast here.”
Reviews.Author: cville16
Reviews.Content: The best reason to book here is the huge free hot breakfast buffet. It gets crowded in the mornings, but we went down around 8:30 every morning and never had a problem finding a table nor did we feel rushed. The furnishings in the rooms are dated but our suite with a balcony on the 5th floor facing Hornby was roomy, quiet and clean. The carpet appeared new and the AC worked well, which was a good thing given the heat wave that hit Vancouver during our stay. If you don’t mind walking, it is possible to explore the Granville Island/Kitsilano area and Stanley Park on foot from the hotel as we did over two days.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, very good service, excellent breakfast, good facilities, good location.”
Reviews.Author: my41
Reviews.Content: excellent value, very good service, excellent breakfast, good facilities, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great room Great service!”
Reviews.Author: WoorldVoyager
Reviews.Content: Appreciated: Free wireless internet service Free hot/cold breakfast of egs, pancakes, fruits, yoghurt, juice, cereal, etc Excellent room and concierge service Great deal Clean, quite, comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: sek0921
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. I can choose my favorite part of my stay because I have a few. First, the customer service here is wonderful...the whole staff knows how to treat customers. Their continental breakfast is unbelievable! The food was fantastic plus it was great to start out each day with food like this! A wonderful hotel all around!!!!

Reviews.Title: “glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: ally011
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were ever so helpful and welcoming,the room was spotless and had everything we needed.The hotel is a short walk to St. Pauls hospital and all shopping was close by on the trendy streets as well as resturants..We had a delicious meal in the hotel resturant and friendly service..it was great to have a good breakfast.lots of choices,and is included in the room rate...It was a bonus to be close to the little aqua boat at the bottom of Pacific ave. it takes you to Granville Island and science world..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariners04
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to all. The suite was spacious and very clean. The bed was one of the most comfortable, with many pillows, that I have ever slept in. The hot breakfast buffet was delicious and the best I have ever experienced where it was included in the price of the hotel. There was always plenty of all the offerings. The location was very good for site seeing and the Hop on Hop off trolley stopped directly at the hotel which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PerthAngie
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Robson St and the ferry's that go to Granville Island. Plenty of food and entertainment options a short distance away, plus a 7-11 on the corner. Huge rooms with all of the essentials (and some more). The breakfast included was great each day if you can get up before 9.30am. Housekeeping staff were lovely and freindly. The airport check in facilities at the hotel was also helpful for those flying.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, too bad about the location”
Reviews.Author: Gillianmb
Reviews.Content: The staff at the desk were really friendly as well as the staff in the bistro. The room was very clean and spacious. The balcony had a spectacular view of Vancouver. The beds were very comfortable and the room was relatively quiet. Breakfast was enjoyable, the food wasn't hot, not even warm, but it was a good selection and it's hard to beat free! All in all, we will certainly consider going back there, the only thing holding us back would be the location, not the nicest part of town nor is it very close to the theatre, arena, or bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Excllent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: beanbag112233
Reviews.Content: We finished up a two week tour or BC in the Cascadia and it was a dream. The location is excellent, close to Davie street with a real community feel and and the big shops a short walk away. The room was spacious and also included full cooking facilities & fridge. The breakfast was self-service and very good, as were meals in the restraunt (recommend the flat iron steak). The self service launderette was spotless and very welcome after 14 days in an RV.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TheNard
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable 4 nights here at Cascadia. We had opted for the King sized bed room so were on 20th floor with fab view over city from own balcony. Room comes with kitchen area which we used for teas/coffees & toast! As highlighted in previous posts, the decor may be a tad passe but rooms all clean and service good. Bed very comfortable. Staff all very welcoming. Disappointed that the pool was having a refurb and we were directed to a sports cente 'round the block' but it wasn't the same as the quick dip before breakfast, as it was a few blocks away. Breakfast was fine and as we were there earlier rather than 'just before the end' we didn't encounter the queues as referred to by other readers. A Manager appears for the last chunk of time to 'direct' the line.... Didn't eat at the hotel but used the bar on Wed eve when there was a 'hotel welcome' which was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: crowbarNL
Reviews.Content: We opted for the full kitchen kig suite. The rooms were not as big as double tree suites, but it reminded me a lot of double tree in Washington DC. everything is a bit dated, but clean and working. The dishwasher, stove and fridge were good. The bathroom a bit small but adequate. The bed was the best so far in canada. It is very easy to get around by bus and a lot of take out and restaurants nearby. The breakfast was the most complete I had in al long time (hot/cold, yoghurts, bagels, waffles,...) The neighbourhood is safe, yes there are some homeless people, but I always felt safe. Pool and gym were out of order. But the gym was relocated to a double room. And of average/normal hotel quality. PS. If you are in good heatlth you can walk (easy) to Granville Island, (nice walk) to the park and a steeper walk to gastown (we did it all). Would go again to this hotel due to price/quality level.

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon in Thunderdome”
Reviews.Author: mrsjulia1212
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for a 4 day honeymoon. Upon check in the night clerk informed us that there had been a rash of break-in's in their gated parking garage, so we emptied our car of ALL items, and retired to our room. The room was not as nice as expected, but had a beautiful view. I was impressed by the hotel's green policy-recycling and compost facilities in the room. We enjoyed a lovely complimentary hot breakfast buffet and set out to explore Vancouver by foot. After a long day out in the pouring rain, we decided we'd head to dinner in our car. As we approached our vehicle we saw broken glass everywhere, and the passenger rear windows had been forcefully smashed, the window frame bent. The hotel manager was helpful, but they had known of the problems in their garage and only after we reported the break-in and a father and his college-bound daughter had the same thing happen did they hire a security guard. It soured us so much on the city that we left Vancouver as fast as we could and spent the last 2 short days of our honeymoon in Victoria. MANY people I have spoke to had the same experience in Vancouver--it seems to have an extreme drug problem and lots of break-ins. We had such a lousy time.

Reviews.Title: “No better value downtown”
Reviews.Author: Wyllie1
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 7 women who stayed for two nights, choosing the Cascadia for the bed-sizes (Queens), price and location. We were not disappointed. We arrived early, yet were given rooms at once by the very friendly front-desk staff. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms clean. A faulty electrical socket was fixed by maintenance immediately. Although the pool was closed for maintenance, we were offered admittance at an alternative location. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were very helpful. Dividing the bill amongst our credit cards was done cheerfully at check-out. The Hop-on, Hop-off Trolley stops right outside the hotel and the skytrain station and Yaletown are a few blocks away. I have stayed in about a dozen hotels downtown and The Cascadia delivers the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sparra53
Reviews.Content: We were directed to a room on the 17th floor - this had not been cleaned since the last guests. We returned to reception and Jenni on eception immediately checked and gave us a new room on floor 14. We were concerned as we had heard there may be noise from elevators and the club below. However the room was great! Fab views over Vancouver and there was noise from teh club but we were told this was being closed down the week we left so would definitely recommend Room 1418 for the sunrise view alone!! along with the comfy bed and the kitchen facilities. Meals in the restaurant were great as well as a mean Mojito mixed by Carly! We would absolutely go back and stay for longer if we could have the same room!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: chrisandsteve45
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel based on previous reviews. Came up to all expectations. Probably top of our range but well worth the money. Breakfast was first class with ample to set you up for the day. Room was large with two double beds and with a small kitchen adequate to produce a small meal. Housekeeping was supurb. Central to a number of restaurants and Granville Island. Number 6 bus, just round the corner, went to Waterfront and Canada place and to the top end of Downtown. Within 15 minute walk of Yaletown station on the Canada Line, although route was a bit uphill to the hotel. Easy and cheap trip from the airport. All in all this hotel was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: or_resident
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay at this hotel. Found the staff to be friendly, helpful and efficient. The room was clean, well-kept, beds were great. The little kitchen area was useful. Although it took a few tries to master the use of the keycard in the elevator, it was a good security measure and generated conversation and laughs for most guests.

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: chrissysunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fabulous deal. The location is amazing for the price- short stroll down the hill to the seabus to Granville island where you can buy amazing food to cook up in the suite. The kitchen is well equipped and has a good fan for food smells. Breakfast included and was a fantastic selection. And the beds and linens were fantastic. The ding of the elevator was annoying and the furniture a bit dated, but the room clean and very spacious. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo/hotel”
Reviews.Author: InfreqFlyer
Reviews.Content: Everything you could want at an extended stay hotel. Stayed at a 1 queen bed, double sofa bed room with wife and young daughter in August for 4 nights. Parking was additional - you'd be shocked at the tax rate. Breakfast buffet was very good. About 5 blocks from Robson Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but rooms need update”
Reviews.Author: Ien
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights from August 6 till August 10. The reception was great with a warm welcome to Canada and Cascadia. Our room was at the 10th floor. It was ok, clean and the kitchenette was good. The beds comfy, we did sleep very well, and not only the timedifference (9 hours) was part of that. The shower was great, the only thing is the curtain, glass is much more hygienic. The free high speed internet did worked perfect, indeed it is fast and free. The breakfast was perfect, many items to choose. The only things were the line at peaktime. The sign at every table: enjoy your breakfast but please do this in 20 minutes, others are waiting, testified no hospitality to us. The pool was good for a plunge after a day walking in de city. For our son it was perfect. The changingroom of the pool was not clean and need a refurb. The hotel is 15 min walk from Robson Street and 7 min walk to the ferry to Granville Island. In march 2010 we already make a reservation. Some months later their was a special (4=3). I mailed the hotel about the special rate. Immediately they changed the reservation. That was perfect. I will recommend this hotel to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great service - best staff at a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom052009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a treasure mainly because of its location and its staff. My husband and 15month old and the staff there was so accommodating. It was for our anniversary and on the date of the anniversary, they sent us up a card wishing us a happy anniversary with some chocolates! How sweet! The hotel was also located in a perfect place for traveling by public transport or walking. The breakfast was AMAZING! and they sat you fairly fast. The only bad thing about this hotel was our bed. We are used to sleeping in a hard bed and this bed was super soft so our backs were killing us by the end. Oh, and if you want quiet, get a room facing the street not the back. There is a club behind the hotel and they are open quite late (till 4pm) and apparently very popular as people were milling around there all night.

Reviews.Title: “"Deluxe" only applies to the price!”
Reviews.Author: CH_GregSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We booked a Deluxe Suite and were very disappointed about what we encountered. The furniture was very old and time-worn, as well in the small living/bed room as in the open kitchen. The bed (mattress) was very soft and I had a backache every single morning after waking up. This is really not the standard I am used to when booking a "Deluxe Suite", considering that it was also quite expensive. Speaking of expensive: If you have your own rental car be warned that they charge an extra fee of $25 per night for parking in their own garage! The entrance to the garage is trough a small alley in the backyard that could frighten anxious people at night. There is also a dubious night club in that alley. The breakfast room is far too small and the breakfast buffet is only open until 9.30 from Mo-Fr, an hour longer on Sa, Su. There are always many people waiting to be seated as the personnel is waiting for people leaving so they can clean the table. There is even a notice on every table and in the elevators asking the guests to limit their breakfast to max 20 mins so other guests can have breakfast too! Some positive points to mention: - Free Internet access (2 PCs in the lobby) available for all guests incl. printer - In-house restaurant with bar has a good selection of nice dishes - Pool and fitness centre, although I didn't use it

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms with kitchenettes on the...”
Reviews.Author: Suetrev64
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with kitchenettes on the route of the hop on hop off trolleys , near Yaletown and Granville Island. Full breakfast included. Was good but service area was undersized for number of guests at peak time, so there was some waiting and pushing you to eat quickly. Nice looking pool and spa. Very Adequate AC for summer - very appreciated. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: midlife_traveler40
Reviews.Content: Although a bit dated in the decore, this hotel was beautiful and very clean! Close to GM place, walking distance for concerts. We were upgraded to a suite on the 19th floor, the view was amazing! Highly recommend this hotel when staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A superb 3* Star Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: JIMMYDEFARGO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good alternative to all the 4* Hiltons, Sheratons, Mariotts etc with rate above the sky... 1. Free wireless and high-speed Internet access!! A lot and especially Hotels in the 200-400$ range still charge for the Internet!!! Well it`s quite price you pay for that hotel, well all Hotels are in Vancouver aren`t cheap. But be advised, you get a lot more value here. The probably biggest benefit is a completely equipped kitchen with quite a large refrigerator with an small intergreted freezer. Housekeeping takes good care of the rooms, so they are quite clean. Room service is also excellent, they have a quite small menu but that what they serve is outstanding and in my oppinion far above 3*. The prices are as well very rational. There is no tray charge and tip is to you`re descretion (no 20% service tax). From the higher floor rooms, facing downtown the view is incredible. And last but not least, you have complymentary breakfast. I can`t say anything about that since I never had time to use... The only drawback is that the hotel is quite a distance from the center downtown. So for shopping on Robsons Street (famous shopping street in Vancouver) or to go to the Waterfront a Taxiride is unavoidable unless you a fan of city hikes. Distance about 10-12 Blocks (Taxiride approx. CAD 8.- one way) But be awere, the Hotels in the ultimate center of Vancouver can cost easly 100 CAD$+ per Night. So this one is a very good option. This Hotel is very recomendable for anybod traveling on a budget or/and would like to have a refrigerator instead of a minibar stocked with 5$ sodas. As well, very recomendable for families in my oppinion. To stock you refrigeratior theres a 7/11 just on the opposide street side. They even allow pets for an additonal cleaning fee (I thing 75$ but I`m not sure)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad hallways”
Reviews.Author: izzydood
Reviews.Content: Going to our room, I thought yikes! This place is a dump! The halls are dark and dank. The room was fine though. The beds were comfortable, the windows big and we appreciated having a couch, desk and small kitchen. It was NOT walking distance to Granville Market. The parking was a little weird - in an alley through 2 security gates, which made me question how safe the area was, but we had no problems. You must use your room key to operate the elevator. The pool was pretty icky. The free hot breakfast was a plus, although they had signs asking you to spend no more than 20 minutes there, which felt a little unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location with a great complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travellinggirl14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights. The room was spacious, simply furnished but very clean and well equipped with kitchen. Location is ten minutes walk (five if you walk quick) from Robson Street. Davie street next door has great little restaurants and a bohemian feel. Breakfast was very busy but included in room rate and grea selection. Friendly staff make this a good all round no frills hotel with a good location as it is central and in a good area of Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: chloewei
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was the last stop of our Canada trip. My daughter and I like the room very much. It is clean, bright and comfortable. Through the window there is a great view of Vancouver whenever is night or day. That is the place can be a temp home during the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Hotel but not nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BioBa
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms, friendly staff, definitely overpiced - next time I rather spend another $50-100 and go to a 5 star. Breakfast was included in price but selection was again only slightly above average.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: AucklandTrammie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for seniors. Great room with view. Very comfortable bed. Pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star Place!”
