Reviews.Author: mintcreative
Reviews.Content: This was a great place - big spacious room with a comfortable set up including full size couch and well equipped kitchenette. We think it was fantastic for a 3 star place and would be absolutely perfect for families wanting to visit the city. You could hear a little noise from the elevators and people in the corridors but it wasn't enough to be a big nuisance to us. It was nice to have someone seating us at breakfast too - we did have to wait but not for long at all and the food was great. The location isn't as central as other places we have stayed in Van, but that's down to a personal preference. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeaniebEssex
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a long flight from the UK, hotel staff were very courteous, room was quiet, large,clean and had kitchen facilites, complimentary breakfast selection was huge - the best of our entire stay in Canada - would definately recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Stac26
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying here. Each time its outstanding. The hotel has unbelievable pricing for its great location, Its in walking distance to Robson Street and minutes away from Granville Island. Couldn't ask for anything better. Staff are friendly and willing to go out of their way. The free breakfast is delicious and a great variety. The hotel is very clean and modern. Couldn't ask for anything better

Reviews.Title: “Such a good experience we stayed again!”
Reviews.Author: daryl_sc
Reviews.Content: On our way into Canada we stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed the great staff and hotel so much we booked for another 2 nights after our Rockies holiday before returning to Australia. Great staff, excellent value and a top location.

Reviews.Title: “avoid rooms -01 and -07”
Reviews.Author: tormell
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very expensive for the quality and noisy. be carfeful if you have an interresting rate, they will give you the rooms that noboby wants : a direct view of the elevators and the associated 24hrs DING DONG when somebody arrives.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the breakfast was to die for!”
Reviews.Author: Omamaud
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and within easy reach of both the shopping area and the harbour. The rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed and the staff is very friendly and willing to go out of their way to help you and answer any questions. The breakfast was one of the best I've had in any hotel ... a wonderful selection of both hot and cold dishes ... it was to die for! Another good feature is the guest laundry, a real plus in my book. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable city suite- but beware the nightclub!”
Reviews.Author: n0ggin
Reviews.Content: Firstly room itself was fine and very comfortable- small kitchen 2* queens beds and bathroom were all perfectly clean and comfy. BUT beware as others have comented on the 3 problems #1If you are in a room away from Hornby St- the nightclub ("Biggest Gay bar in the city!") next street down is noisy from 11pm-4am every night, watch if you are a light sleeper. BUT staff were great when I asked to move rooms. #2 Lifts are totally inadequate at breakfast time- we ended up walking down 11 flights #3 Brealkfast was a bit hit and miss- yes I know it's a free buffet but it seemed chaotic every morning and if you are a late sleeper chances are things will have run out

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chackoccino
Reviews.Content: My family (parents & sibling) and I stayed here the last week of July for a pleasure trip. The hotel is centrally located to everything and it helps that it doesn't take more than 10 minutes to get anywhere by car in downtown (providing there's minimal traffic). My parents' room had a balcony and a full kitchen; my sibling and I stayed in a 2 bed room with a smaller kitchen but stocked with more kitchenware; both rooms had more than enough space for all 4 of us to relax. The breakfast buffet was very tasty; the staff are very nice, welcoming and helpful. The only issue I had was with the amount of dust in the rooms. There was dust all over every surface including the linens, towels, everything. I would have a coughing fit upon entering the room. Even after housekeeping cleaned our rooms, there was still lots of dust. I even shook out my towel (out of the window) to see how much lint would come off and it kept coming after a few minutes of continuous shaking. BLEH! Other than that, the room was clean. Also, if you have a car, I highly recommend not using their parking garage; it was $25/day! I thought we would have trouble finding street parking, but we were always able to find parking in front of the hotel; that part of the neighborhood seemed pretty quiet. The meters have to be fed between 9am - 10pm, but we were usually not there between those hours, so no worries! At the most we fed the meter for about 3 hours total in the week that we were there. All in all, a great place to stay and I'd stay again if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Bedroom, Living Room, Kitchen & Bathroom everything got a family of four.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDick
Reviews.Content: Our family of four could have lived in this hotel room as it was like a furnished apartment, complete with a dishwasher for our dirty dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel Saving Time & Money”
Reviews.Author: TheTuetonicCelts
Reviews.Content: Location - Right in the heart of downtown Vancouver. You can walk to Kitsilano beach, Stanley Park, Chinatown, Gastown, the harbour and Granville Island. This means no expensive transport costs or taxis. Reception - You feel like you are out of the rush of the city immediately you walk into the hotel. The staff are a credit to the hotel. Friendly, helpful and always available. Rooms - The pictures on the hotel website are accurate. The beds are very comfortable, the space is fine, and each room comes with fridge, microwave, hob, dishwasher, and coffee machine. The rooms are also air conditioned and have the usual TV (if not flatscreen). The internet is both wireless and wired. It is easy to hook up with, and very fast, as well as being free. There are loads of supermarkets nearby, so you can also make yourself a nice lunch, if you are bored of resturants and want to save your wallet. The only downside is you get some street noise, so ask for a high floor room. Breakfast - This is complimentary with with rooms, and is absolutley yummy. Full choice of everything you can eat to a high quality. Can sometimes be busy, so it might mean waiting 5-10 mins for a table if you are a bit slow to get there. Swimming pool and jacuzzi - won't win any awards but are adequate to keep kids happy and let off some city steam. How to get there from airport - Get the Canada train to Yaletown and then walk 10-15 mins to hotel. Avoid the expensive taxis. Deals - Go to the hotel's own website. You will find the best deals there. The absolute best is a Web special of 3 nights for the price of 2. This comes with $10 token to starbucks. All in all a brilliant hotel that will save you money over "cheaper" alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel stay but restaurant needs work.”
Reviews.Author: Wooby30
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay. They served a very extensive breakfast - but you should get there early to avoid a long line. And we also had a small kitchen in the room which was very convenient. I did have two concerns. First, they didn't have a recumbent bike (as advertised) so I couldn't exercise as expected. Second, we went in for dinner one night and ended up waiting for 1 1/4 hours by the time they brought the meal. Evidently, the restaurant was hit with a load of room service orders. Instead of apprising us of the expected wait, they took our order and then kept us sitting and waiting. Each time we asked about the meal, we were told the order was coming right up. And when we got up to leave, were again told that the meal was on its way. The food, when it arrived, was excellent but by that time, even the menu would have tasted good. The manager apologized by comping the meal which was very nice of them, but I wouldn't go in to eat there again without checking just how busy the restaurant was.

Reviews.Title: “Great but look for a good price”
Reviews.Author: AH1111
Reviews.Content: Nice roomy suite hotel 10 mins from the downtown shopping / museums, 10 mins from Yaletown. Would take the bus to Stanley park as a little too far to stroll in hot weather. Clean, good service, well located & as they are suites the rooms were well equipped & spacious with kitchenette inc hot plates, microwave, dishwasher, high speed internet, desk & TV. Decor is a little dated - no flat screen etc, but ok. I got a great deal on this hotel via the Trip Advisor links, so was pleased with the value for money. Although the hotel itself had a deal on, the different links had quite different prices so worth chechking them all out - saved me an extra £50 on a two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Great staff, Glorious Food”
Reviews.Author: dali_girl
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyed my stay. The bed and pillows so soft and comfy! More than enough room for lounging in the living area. The staff made every effort to make my stay the best it could be. There were noise factors outwith control of the hotel (local pub and road works). Turning on the air unit drowned out most of those noises. The best part of the morning was the breakfast buffet; Tons of variety and all freshly prepared plus I got to watch WorldCup on the television. Did not try the attached restuarant but the menu was impressive. The accommodations are good but the 110% attitudes of the staff made it great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Southwards
Reviews.Content: All the simple things that make a hotel stay comfortable were done well. The room was clean, comfortable, well-equipped & quiet. The staff were efficient & friendly, including the breakfast staff. The breakfast itself was excellent although the room was very busy at peak times. The complimentary wi-fi was easy to connect to and fast. The location was good, everywhere within easy walking distance (15-20 minutes). Above all, compared with other hotels in Vancouver and in cities elsewhere in the world, the Cascadia was excellent value. It does what it says on the tin and we're looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “good place and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: marthark
Reviews.Content: There was a nice pool and jacuzzi, and clean comfortable rooms with kitchen. We had two great beds and a small kitchen with microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator and stove. We had very friendly service. My daughter and I walked all over Vancouver with her one and a half year old son. The service people except perhaps in the breakfast buffet) were very friendly. It is within walking distance of the beach and ferry. Martha

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Nadia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over 4th of July weekend. We got it for $120 plus tax which I think was a good price for the place. Of course with our luck on July 1st BC government decided to raise service tax from 5% to 12% and parking tax from 15% to 35%, which added a chunk of cash to our planned expenses. Not hotel's fault of course, just heads up :) Good points: - Good location, walking distance to all major attractions. A couple of good sushi places in the area. - Relatively friendly and efficient front desk - when we asked to be on the side opposite to the supposedly loud night club the girl at the front desk first wanted to "upgrade" us for $20/night, but then found a room for the original price. We did have to wait for it to be ready. - Parking is secure and is not as expensive as other hotels, from what I understand. Ours came up to $26/night including tax - They have a free computer with Internet and free printer in the lobby, which is very convenient if you need to print out your tickets or say vouchers for trolley/excursions - The room was spacious and relatively clean. We were on the 14th floor and had a great view. - Bed was comfortable and had nice sheets and pillows - Kitchenette was fully equipped, but cooking your own food in a place like Vancouver is a total waste, in my opinion. So many good places to eat over there! - Breakfast was pretty decent for a free breakfast. It had scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, sausage/patties, french toast, pancakes, oatmeal, yogurt, some fruit. Definitely not restaurant quality, but much better than anything I ever had for free in a hotel. Other: - Our room was clean and made up, but had a thick layer of dust on all the flat surfaces. As if no one stayed in it for a few days after it had been cleaned. Which sort of didn't make a lot of sense, since the girl at the reception made us wait for it "to be cleaned and ready". Dust gave the room a bit of a unclean feeling. I had to get some paper towels and wipe the dust before we started unpacking. - Toiletries (shampoo and conditioner) smelled real bad, so bring your own - Breakfast service, just like other reviewers mentioned, was very hectic. . Breakfast ladies were efficient borderline aggressive. Especially 10 minutes or so before the scheduled end of the breakfast service they were on the mission to get everyone out of the room and start cleaning. So if you want to have your breakfast in a leisure manner - come at least 40 min before the ending time. - Common areas (hallways, pool bathroom) looked very run down and not as clean as the rooms. Bathroom didn't have soap, lockers were rusty. Overall, for the price we paid - I think it was a decent place and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: david_tanya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cascadia during our recent trip to Vancouver after purchaing the hotel through Hotwire for $99. It was a spectacular deal for $99! The room was very spacious, had a kitchenette and an amazing view of downtown Vancouver. Wireless and breakfast (the best hotel breakfast I’ve ever had!) were included in the price. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to all major attractions. Parking was an additional $17/night, which wasn’t bad considering that most hotels charge in excess of $40/night. I’m told that the normal rates for this hotel are between $185-$210 – I wouldn’t pay that price for the hotel. But if you can get the hotel for $130 or less, then I think it’s definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Check in elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jackandjill-toronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is found along a oneway street and can be easliy missed. The room we had was not as pictured. We could hear the elevator at night. In addition we could hear the night club or people boozing it up the until the early hours of the morning. The windows that should have been double paned seemed to have single panes of glass. By 8a.m. there was trickle of warm water for a warm shower and then the breakfast buffet was busy and did not have enough seating to accomodate the volume of people. Parking although underground is tight and I do not recommend bringing a large vehicle here. The fact we had to drive through two security gates intially makes you feel secure but makes you question why is it necessary. Might be the location. Parking you pay for as you seem to do everywhere in Vancouver. Do not be fooled, things are not that close. You need a car to visit the harbour and sites throughout the city and you pay for parking everywhere else too. By the second night of our stay, there was a musty smell in our room. Very disappointing and I am expecting another noisy night outside. Thank God it was our last night there. One saving grace, the staff were helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place!!”
Reviews.Author: JRCZAR
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Ta reviews and boy were we impressed. This is the place to stay, the rooms, staff and location, location, location. This will be our destination in Vancouver. The breakfast is wonderful, many selections, thanks to the staff and management. See you again Soon!!

Reviews.Title: “served the purpose....”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: The Cascadia was a no frills but adequate hotel. The room was a fair size and as requested it was quiet. The front desk staff were OK, fairly helpful in that one chap went out of his way to ensure that i had gluten free bread at breakfast! As there was no way that the breakfast staff could find me some! The breakfast was mass produced rubbery eggs with potato one morning or sausage the next. There was a container of melon and watery coffee. If i was to stay in Vancouver again on a stopover on my way back home to NZ I would look for somewhere with a bit of personality or just something memorable which would make me want to return. This had nothing but basic amenities minus any welcoming attributes.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room NOT facing Howe Street or bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: jaydarl
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel somewhat off the beaten path but only a short walk to the beaten path. Friendly staff, clean public spaces and rooms. A fantastic morning breakfast. Great Internet service both wired and wireless in room. Also two Internet computers in the small but neat lobby. Okay now to the bad part. By all means, stay at this hotel but make sure you tell the clerk to get you a room facing Hornby Street, (the front) because the back of the hotel faces a nightclub that exudes typical nightclub noise to your room, at least for those of us on the lower floors.. Thank God I was dead tired or I would have been miserable. The next day I purchased earplugs just in case I was not so tired. In conclusion, if it was not for the nightclub behind the hotel I could see myself giving this hotel 5 stars but I can see some guest having a night of pure torture if they are placed in a room facing that club. Still, I recommend this hotel as long as you get a front facing room

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great room”
Reviews.Author: JACKSON357
Reviews.Content: The room, amenities, view, staff and breakfast were all we hoped for. Clean, comfortable room; Safe, secure building and parking. Only a 15 or 20 minute walk from the convention center, and less to stores & museums. Everything we wanted for under $200, including a kitchen and balcony!! And then there's the Canadian "add-ons"... $24 a night (w/tax) for parking... AND another $30 per Nt for room taxes (4 nights) Just want your eyes open and wallet ready... :) The city is Beautiful... Bring Lots of money, and be prepared to leave it there... (This ain't Mexico)

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get and maybe a little bit more.”
Reviews.Author: Kerry49
Reviews.Content: The room and the condition of the interior of the hotel were in impeccable condition as displayed in the photos online. The hotel staff always greeted you with a smile and were always ready to serve.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cuddlysmith
Reviews.Content: As I write this I'm sitting on the sofa in our room at Cascadia. we have had a perfect holiday, and the hotel made it even more so. Firstly; great location, a 15 min walk to Canada Place, 10 mins to Robson Street, we even walked to the Aquarium in less than 30 mins!! Big Bus stop is also right around the corner. The included breakfast was great, plenty to keep us satisfied. Room was large with a comfy bed and fantastic view over to Granville Island and surrounding apartments. I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Marlscat
Reviews.Content: We spent three separate nights at this hotel as part of our mini tour of Canada and were allocated a different room each time, which were 1010, 1112 and 1009 (the first two were to the back of the hotel and the last one to the front). All of the rooms were more or less the same and were studio type with a small kitchen that included microwave, cooker, tea and coffee making facilities, fridge, dishwasher, crockery and cutlery etc. There was also a sofa and TV and very comfortable beds. The bathroom was en-suite with toiletries provided, hairdryer and over-bath shower. Breakfast was complimentary and served in the dining room on the second floor. Although always busy, there was ample choice and the food was good. The second floor is also where the pool and launderette are situated. Ice and soft drinks machines were also located on certain floors of the hotel. There was free wi-fi provided in the rooms and there were two computers in reception for guests to use. We found the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful – nothing was too much trouble for them. If you required your luggage to be kept safe, there was a locked room available for this. The location of the hotel was also good, being only a short walk to the local ferries over to Granville Island, and about a 20 minute walk to ‘downtown’ Vancouver. A local taxi to the Gastown area and to Canada Place was around $8. We spent a very pleasant three nights here and I would certainly recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Vancouver for Families!”
Reviews.Author: pstonek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cascadia with my two young sons and loved it. The room was very clean and had a full kitchenette with a fridge. This was really helpful with young kids. It also had a nice pool and a great buffet breakfast that was included. We received great service and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It was an awesome stay at an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: RampBreaker
Reviews.Content: this hotel located at vancouver sorrounded by sea , very good weather, fantastic shopping place and very nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: uk220381
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when running in the Vancouver Marathon. Didn't spend much time coz I was a kinda busy at that moment, but they allowed me to use shower even after checked out after the marathon. Have to mention that people there are nice and friendly. Not cheap but highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in downtown, Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Nensukh
Reviews.Content: Its one of the best hotel in downtown, Vancouver. I had chance to stay in Marriot for 6 months during my business visit to Vancouver. Its located at very prime location, having all the good amenities. I still remember the break fast we used to get in Marriot. Its awsome.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again”
Reviews.Author: newdaytoday
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel with great staff and good service and a delicious breakfast that is included. When we arrived, I normally wash all the dishes in the kitchenette, but was pleased to see that everything was clean. Washrooms were also clean. Beds were comfortable. Everything worked. I had to call for support for a wireless network connection and they fixed my problem - quickly and correctly. The breakfast is amazing - eggs, french toast, fresh fruit, cereal, bagels, muffins and they don't run out 15 minutes before it is over. Although we didn't use them, the pool and work out room were available and in great shape. When I asked for help at the front desk to find a flower shop, they not only looked one up but called to check on their hours - amazing and then gave me directions on how to get there. Would stay here again any day!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome free breakfast and has a pool!!”
Reviews.Author: pbgayte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over spring break. When searching, we looked for a hotel that has both pool and breakfast included. The list gets pretty small when you do that but let me just say that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. From the moment we were greeted at check in to the moment we checked out the staff was fabulous! Loved the free breakfast buffet (very extensive) and my teenage boys loved the pool! The beds were comfy too. We'll definitely stay here again. Loved the location. Thanks Cascadia!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: T-1SJCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying four nights at Cascadia. It was a great experience. The location of the hotel is close to Granville Island, down the street from Davie St, and a 5-10 walk to Robson St. The hotel staff was extremely helpful in every request. The maid service was super. The room was equipped with a microwave, refrigerator and stove. My boys made use of the indoor swimming pool, jacuzzi and work out room. Every morning we took advantage of the free breakfast, which for a family of three saved $25 day. All in all I strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very accomidating and helpful in all our needs”
Reviews.Author: DianaMc_10
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice time at the Cascadia Hotel. Buffet was great, housekeeping was great w/ lots of extra towels and blanket, room was clean, mini kitchen was a nice addition, people at the main desk were very nice and helpful, food in the cafe was good. Nice pool, but was expecting something larger and it wasn't always clean. Card swipe in the elevator was kind of a pain. Overall I think our trip was great. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: travellvr52
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to Robson Street, Yaletown and boat to Granville Island. Our double room had a kitchenette and couch in good sized room. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieCalgary
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and have to pat Cascadia Management and staff on the back for incredible customer service. It's the little touches that make such a difference such as the email confirming my reservation 3 days prior to arriving, the ease and convenience of parking, the friendly smiles and genuine interest from all staff. The breakfast included in my stay was fabulous with extensive choices served buffet style and I'm thankful that the coffee served was delicious and plentiful. My room was imaculate, bed was very comfortable, excellent high speed connection and the convenience of the hotel location made moving around the city easy. Valerie

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location with extras”
Reviews.Author: OntarioVacationer51
Reviews.Content: I stayed from the 5th to 14th of March. Very clean, excellent service, freindly helpful staff. Enjoyed the full breakfast , newspaper, free internet and kitchen facilities. Close to grocery and convienence stores. There was a BBQ available on Second floor in garden area that I didn't use. Less than 10 min. walk to Robson Square walking distance to Stanley Park and the Aquarium. Good view from 18th floor. I will definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilangilang
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Vancouver and styed at Cascadia on 1234 Hornby St. We enjoyed our stay at this hotl. Very good value for money and the free breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, good location and a very good breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place...”
Reviews.Author: jamesmac01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in Jan and it was our last stop. We nearly saved the best for last. The room was huge, the perfect size. Breakfast was a great way to start each day and the staff at MiBistro were so friendly we decided to eat there every night. The amenities were great and the location superb. Look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: silverleaf8802
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and hot breakfast. excellent location, I stay at 8th floor, I hope I can stay higher level next time. parking is very good. the linen for the room is excellent. I will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Canuck72
Reviews.Content: Well-situated, great service, great rooms. I definitely recommend this to travellers. This used to be a Marriott Residence Inn - so you have all the facilities you need in your room, and with breakfast included you save even more money. I have stayed in two other Vancouver hotels, the Plaza 500 and the Sandman. The Cascadia was by far the best - best location, best price and best service in this price range of hotels. The only negative was there was some noise on the south side of the hotel at night as there is some sort of club there that is open late.

Reviews.Title: “This is the ONE!!”
Reviews.Author: DebiLynn706
Reviews.Content: All the staff I came across during my five nite stay were very friendly and helpful from the desk clerks, the food services people, the housekeeping staff, etc....i enjoyed my stay here immensely and will certainly return. The room was large with very comfortable beds, a couch, a well stocked kitchenette (dishes, utensils, etc), a spacious, very clean bathroom, lots of pillows and a nice view from the 9th floor. The breakfast buffet each morning exceeded my expectations with everything very tasty and the breakfast room has great ambience; room service was quick and tasty; the hotel is within walking distance of shopping; convenient bus service within a block away and abundance of metered parking on street when friends visited... the pool and whirlpool area was great and very clean and the gym looked great. This hotel had everything I was looking for in a hotel from being accessable for me, the wireless internet in rooms, kitchenette, very clean large rooms, and a breakfast buffet as a bonus plus a very attractive lobby all within my budget. This was my 3rd visit to Vancouver in the past year and my best pick for a hotel....I dont think I will stay anywhere else now. I can't say enough about these accommodations. The Cascadia Hotel & Suites spoiled me and I thank them for a very enjoyable stay in my favorite city to visit for a short get-a-way.

Reviews.Title: “the Cascadia is always a great place to stay, breakfast is top and Mi Bistro a great restaurant on it's own right”
Reviews.Author: dampex13
Reviews.Content: wonderful property always has great deals, if you are traveling with kids a great place to keep snacks and prepare light lunches. Breakfast is awesome at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully convienent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvalexy
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my mother on a trip to visit the UBC campus and Vancouver, we found this hotel was an excellent choice to stay. Minutes walking from movies, restaurants, numerous cafes and shops. Nearby bus stops to get you to all parts of Vancouver with ease. This hotel is located on a more quiet street but just really a wonderful downtown locations. The breakfast included was great, and the kitchenette included was a wonderful treat to have. Also, the free wireless internet was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Cascadia's excellent value + great location = a winner!”
Reviews.Author: ORsightseer
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights between Christmas/New Year with my husband and 22 year old daughter. Rooms are basic in terms of decor--but very clean with wonderful mattresses and luxurious sheets. Didn't use the kitchen at all--yes, it's small, but would be ok if one wanted to prepare a simple meal. Free breakfast a nice touch, but food isn't terrific. The Staff who clear the tables, and find you a seat are lovely, as are the housekeepers who clean your room. Good location (away from crowds, but nice walk to Robson St. and water taxi to Granville Island) along with very reasonable price for Vancouver, make this hotel a winner and worth your consideration if you are not interested in glitz but care most about comfort and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Secwepemc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times with the latest being in August 2009. We will be going back to this hotel after trying out a couple other places since. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are roomy and comfortable for four people. Free internet is reliable. Pool is decent and hotel is well secured. 7-11 just across the street and Tim Hortons around the corner. Beds and pillows are pure comfort heaven! As an added bonus they have a buffet type of breakfast that is included with your room. It is very good with a great selection of food. The only downside this hotel has that it is a bit of a hike from Robson street if you want to go shopping. We caught a cab back for a few dollars so no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Samck Dab in the middle...”
Reviews.Author: bombakid
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Even better service. We loved Emma! My wife and I stayed in a suite, so I'm sure the room is nicer than a regular one. But it was terrific and very comfortable. We loved the bed and the nice kitchen. Vancouver is already a tight community, but the location of this hotel really is close to everything. We walked everywhere. Even the breakfast was nice, it needed a bit more fresh fruit though. Thanks Cascadia!

Reviews.Title: “Style with Comfort and Convenience.”
Reviews.Author: NamgisDiva
Reviews.Content: I throughly enjoy staying at Cascadia Hotel & Suites which is conveniently located right downtown. The location is just an enjoyable stroll to Robson Street and Graville Street and Davie Street and not too far from Yaletown as well. I also found the staff to be friendly and very helpful in seeing that my needs were met and enjoyed the respect that the hotel staff has for my privacy as well. I have stayed at this hotel a few times for the clean and comfortable rooms and have recommended the hotel to my friends, business collegues and family.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money, good breakfast, OK location”
Reviews.Author: 2009Canada
Reviews.Content: I would say that it was a good value for the money, good location, though it seemed a little sketchy in the beginning. I walked by myself at night the second night and it seemed quite safe. It's just one street down Davie (Davie and Burard) towards the water. It doens't seem like a very nice area, just old and not pleasant looking, but it's actually OK. The area is very close to the water...in walking distance, around ~ 20 min and also close to Burard and Robson...around 10-15 min walk. The hotel staff was not that friendly the first night we got there, but I think it depends of who's working, because they were friendly other times. We had some problems with the bath tub backing up, but they fixed it fast the first night. The breakfast is quite good, with everything we wanted; eggs, fruits, cereal etc...definitely more than we expected. And the fact that it has free internet, which worked very well, was another bonus. The hotel lobby looks pretty old, it definitely need some renovations. I was actually scared of how the rooms are going to look after seeing the lobby...the hallways don't look that great either, but the room turned out to be very nice and clean. The bathroom was very clean. The beds were actually quite comfortable. It turned out to be a very good choice...

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality for the Price....”
Reviews.Author: piscesrising
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The room was really nice, with a kitchenette, including dishwasher, which made cleanup a breeze and the bed linens were 5 star. The housekeeping service was top-notch; fast, friendly and professional. The only draw back was the free breakfast buffet. It was okay , but didn't equal the level of everything else. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can.”
Reviews.Author: RIEmpress
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on a special reduced rate offered through the tourism office and reviews on t Trip Advisor. Our advice - stay here if you are visiting Vancouver. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly (the front desk staff are magicians and can give you information on everything from bus routes to restaurants) and the location is at the lower end of Hornby St., a few blocks from the AquaBus to Granville Island. We'll never go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Free Internet. So important to be able to contact our sons.”
Reviews.Author: sjsuth
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel. Great location and very comfortable.The price was a bit scary but it was inclusive on our Rocky Mountaineer trip.So few hotels provide internet for travellers without laptops and it was great to be able to email friends and family especially as we were out of New Zealand for 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: EddyCalgary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cascadia with some friends while we were in town for the U2 concert. The hotel was very clean, had secure underground parking and a decent hot breakfast that's included in the room price. The rooms also had a full kitchen and decent sitting area which is nice if you're staying for a few days. The location was great. You can walk to Robson Street for shopping or straight down Hornby Street to take a water taxi to Granville Island. There are lots of restaurants nearby. Almost no need for the rental car that we had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: LandRover56
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, good room with a view of downtown, good location for business, free high speed internet. excellent breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good value, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazzy02
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks in this hotel staying in Vancouver for the first time while we explored the town. Room was spacious, spotlessly clean and the two queen sized beds were comfortable. The crockery, cutlery etc. supplied with the kitchen was new and clean - so often in hotels with kitchen facilities these utensils look as though they've been gathered over many years and are a real mish-mash and look a bit dubious. Dishwasher, fridge and microwave were also included. Everything worked. Breakfast included almost everything you could wish for. All hotel staff were very friendly, from the front desk to the room maids. Front desk were also very helpful with information on how to get to places and advice on how to use the local transport system. Nothing was too much trouble. Hornby Street itself is fairly quiet as it's not directly on a bus route, although you do get occasional sirens from ambulances going to the hospital on Burrard Street which is the next street down but the double glazing is very good! The price for the facilities it provided represents good value. Would definitely stay here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: allanian
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, friendly staff. Great restaurant. Decent sized room. Great breakfast buffet. Also kitchen in room if you want to prepare your own breakfast or make your own coffee. Very central. Close to Canada Line for access to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised could not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeventiesDad
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless swimming pool and hot tub were very welcome at the end of the day. Would recommend hiring bikes and exploring Stanley park, not impressed with Granville island very run down.

Reviews.Title: “So good I stayed twice”
Reviews.Author: KeithfromPattaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days either side of a Rocky Mountaineer trip. Its all been said already on this site. Its a fabulous hotel with good service . a brilliant location, friendly staff and a fabulous breakfast. The airport transfer bus stops right outside the main door as do the hop on hop off sightseeing buses. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “fantastically comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rottweilerQueensland
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel great rooms, comfortable beds. Staff helpfull, friendly. Breakfast delicious. Thankyou to all the staff at Cascadia for making our stay stress free and great.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone considering visiting Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Del_Amitri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The room was clean, comfortable and big with all the conveniences you could need. Free wi-fi and wired, fast internet was a big bonus for me.The staff were friendly and attentive. The buffet breakfast has lots to offer and really sets you up for the day. A great hotel, really glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: NaomiO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of September 2009. We booked through 'Tourism Vancouver' and got a really good deal. I spent ages deliberating about where to stay in Vancouver since it is quite expensive. This place had good reviews on Trip Advisor so we went for it. We were very happy. We were on 16th floor, a decent size room with a kitchen and living area. It was spotlessly clean and had a pleasant view (we had a balcony). The rate (to our surprise) included a buffet breakfast - which was very good, with lots of hot food. The hotel had a gym and swimming pool but we didn't use them. The location is very good - you can walk everywhere. The train is about 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mariopalmi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very good location, personnel is very friendly and effective, restaurant has great food (Bonus!!!), room is well designed, very quiet and with a excellent bed/pillow. Highly recommended!!! Just one thing... If you are driving a car, I think the parking is too expensive at $20/day. But there is alternative parking around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended--a really great experience for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at the Cascadia and really enjoyed our stay. We requested and were granted check in several hours early. Our room was spotlessly clean and very spacious (a studio apartment) with two queen sized beds, a comfortable sitting area and well equipped kitchen and bathroom. The complementary, full buffet breakfast offered a wide range of hot and cold choices and got us off to a great start each morning. We found the staff (front desk, concierge and housekeeping) to be exceptionally friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was great, close to many good restaurants (lots of sushi restaurants) on Davie Street, great people-watching and within walking distance of English Bay and other points of interest. This hotel offers tremendous value at a reasonable price--a terrific place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Stay Comfortable-More than impressed”
Reviews.Author: MCGC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our son, 8 and daughter 6 years old for a five day stay in Vancouver. We were visiting to sight see but also to visit with family in the area so found this to be the perfect home away from home. We stayed in a room on the sixth floor with a balcony (Room 609). The room was comfortable and clean. We had two queen beds, a sofa, and a small kitchenette (small refrigerator, microwave, sink, two burner stove-top and all cooking and eating utensils). They provide a coffee maker and kettle with complimentary coffee, tea, sugar and sweetner. All the utensils we needed to prepare meals for our family was available. The grocery stores were conveniently located a few blocks away. We took transit to Granville Island Market one day to buy fresh meat, fruit and vegetables. The free wireless internet was great for communicating with family who live in the area, playing computer games for the kids and searching for places in the area. We took our laptop with us for these purposes and didn't regret it. The location was convenient and many of the tour buses stopped right in front of the building. The staff were friendly and helpful. Security was excellent as you needed your room key to use the elevator. The breakfast buffet was incredible with a wide variety of foods to choose from, even for my picky kids. We chose to eat outside on the patio most mornings, which was great for the kids, who could be a bit noisy. The place was busy but we never waited for a table and never felt rushed or left hungry. I was shocked at the size of the eating area and the variety of foods and drinks available! The staff, especially Serena, at the buffet, were busy but happy, friendly and efficient! We used the pool three times and enjoyed it. It is a basic pool with a jacuzzi and workout room next to it. Towels can be picked up at the front desk for use in the pool. There was no safe in the room but safe deposit boxes are available at the front desk. I would have appreciated a table on the balcony to eat at or put our drinks on, there were only 2 chairs. I would stay there again, no questions asked!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: nisaq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cascadia suites for 3 nights (17-19 Aug 2009) as part of our West Coast US/Canada trip. The reception staff are great- very welcoming and helpful with any queries I had. The room we were allocated was more like a studio apartment with a small kitchen and seperate living room area. This made a welcome change from your usual hotel room, and the extra space was appreciated! The room was also very well maintained by the hotel staff. The inclusive breakfast was by far the best breakfast we had!! They have a number of options and regardless of the fact the hotel was fully booked during our stay there, items were replenished quickly. The hotel is also in a great location, close to all the main attractions. I would definately stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “My whole family is happy!”
Reviews.Author: mike_at_los_altos_CA
Reviews.Content: We (dad, mom, 7yrs old, 9 yrs old) stayed at casadia 4 days 3 nights in Aug 2009. We were quite happy with the overall experience. Location: we parked our car and walked to most locations - Granville island vs aquabus, Davie St, Robson St, Gaslamp district and Chinatown (a bit far). We were happy that the hotel was centrally located. We also drive to the Kits pool and beach, Stanley Park and North Vancouver with no problem at all. Public Area: Lobby was clean. Service was quick. The hotel personnals were very helpful. They were knowledgable and able to give us traveling advises - travel direction, resturant info and recommendation. The self-serve breakfast was very good. They provide pancakes, sausage, egg, bread, bagel, pastries, cereal, fruit, coffee, juice, etc. The Indoor pool was small-ish but my kids liked it a lot. We did not use the exercise room but it looks decent. We used guest laundry facility - $6.00 for one load of detergent, washing and drying. We parked our rental car in the underground parking lot and this wasn't covered bywhat we paid for in expedia ROOM: it was great. It has a living room area with sofa, desk and a small kitchen. Bed was comfortable. Bedding and towel were clean. My room was facing the main street (hornby?).

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: supermom46
Reviews.Content: The website completely over sells this hotel. I thought this would be a great spot for our family to vacation in Vancouver. I was wrong on so many levels. We stayed the one night, barely w arrived at midnight, and were gone by 10 am the next day. I could not in good allow my family to stay in such a dive. It was dirty, the gentleman greeting me as we checked in couldn't even bother to iron his shirt for his shift. Not a good first impression. The room was small, damp, and in need of a severe makeover. Our view of the vacant lot with a homeless person climbing in the garbage bin for bottles and cans was not appealling in way, shape, or form. Personally I felt ripped off and almost feel like requesting my money back. The only good service we received was upon leaving and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Upe47
Reviews.Content: wonderful location, very clean, very courteous and helpful staff, great parking facility if you are renting a car(extra charge for this), good gym facility, good pool(did not use but many others did), excellent breakfast every morning even though it was busy-but well organized and had to wait only one day very nice concierge staff that were also helpful overall an excellent value and excellent stay and it was the staff that really made this place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tipsfromtucson
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother, and I stayed for 3 nights in 2 rooms at the Cascadia during July 2009. The rooms were quite spacious and comfortable. A kitchenette was included. The beds were also very comfortable. The hotel staff were excellent. We did not all arrive at the same time, and they arranged for my mother, a senior citizen, to check in early. They also were very helpful in telling us the best way to get to various attractions as well as the ferry terminal. The hotel location is great if you plan primarily to visit attractions in downtown Vancouver and Stanley Park. It is only a few blocks to the water taxi to the Granville Island Public Market. It also is convenient for walking to attractions downtown, and bus stops are very close as well. Many low-cost dining options are within a few blocks, in addition to convenience stores and a supermarket. The room rates, which were quite low for the quality, included breakfast. Breakfast was not just the usual pastries and coffee. It consisted of pastries, cereal, toast, yogurt and granola, juices, coffee and tea, and various hot dishes such as sausage and eggs. For convenience, my mother and I tried the hotel restaurant one evening. We had salads, which were fresh and good. Service could have been better, but we felt the server was responsible for way too many tables. Our only real complaint was that there was considerable street noise (loud people) late at night. The hotel itself was quiet and certainly couldn't control the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Henryjen
Reviews.Content: Staff at reception were friendly and efficient. The concierge was particularly helpful when we asked him for advice. Our room was spacious, tastefully decorated and had cooking facilities. A lovely buffet breakfast was included in the room rate. Good location, the bus stop was just a short stroll away or you could walk to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Place to stay in downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TheDoktor
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Cascadia can be summed up in one word - excellent. The room was clean and comfortable. Having a kitchenette with all the utensils was super convenient and you have a variety of convenience and grocery stores with in a few blocks of the hotel - a 7-11 right across the street. The daily breakfast buffet was great and helped start each day. I did not have a chance to use the on premises restaurant and bar but I heard from several guests that it was fairly good Walking distance to just about everywhere though public transit is just around the corner. There are many ways to get downtown from the airport, Airporter Bus which will stop at most hotels, taxi and limo - with the added convenience of the Skytrain (Canada Line) later this year. I generally use public transit - fairly convenient, cheap and gives you a locals eye view of the city. You can grab a book of tickets from the convenience store on the first level (domestic terminal). Route424 to Airport Station stops right outside then 98-B straight downtown (runs every 10-15 minutes). Make sure to make use of the many water ferries - quickest (and fun) way across False Creek to Granville Island or take the Marine Museum ride over to Vanier Park where its a short walk to Kitslano beach. You can also use the SeaBus to jump over to North Vancouver where you van catch a bus to Grouse Mountain or Capilano I've stayed in Vancouver frequently over the years and stayed at several downtown hotels and I'd say this hotel is one of the best of them and was quite affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: sylibarra2
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very comfortable. Everyone was exceptionally helpful and nice. The breakfast buffet was very good. We will definitely recommend this highly to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great service; Acceptable price”
Reviews.Author: Tomand
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Our stay was wonderful. Price is not cheap, but good for Vancouver in the summer. You get a lot for the price. You get a small suite, a pool and a great breakfast for the price of just a room without a pool or breakfast at many comparable hotels in downtown Vancouver. The service was fine, staff memers were friendly and helpful. The building is in a good location. It is close to Granville Island and a moderate walk to the waterfront near the cruise docks. There are plenty of restaurants of all descriptions nearby. The pool was bigger than many hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great location and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: sangasong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the southwestern part of downtown Vancouver called "Yaletown". There are sushi restaurants on every ... street corner, as well as late-night pizza joints. My boyfriend and I were staying here for 3 days to attend a wedding, and it was great. Every Thursday, the hotel hosts a happy-hour in the cocktail lounge with free yummy appetizers and non-alcoholic drinks. There is also a free hot breakfast each morning that includes sausages, scrambled eggs, yogurt, fruit, bagels, english muffins, etc.-- a nice start to each day. The room itself had a complete mini-kitchen, including fridge, stove, oven, dishwasher, and all the kitchenware you would need to cook and eat your own meal-- very convenient! One of my favorite activities was going to the beach at the Spanish Banks, where the ground is so flat, the tide recedes about 50 yards during low-tide and you can walk for ages into the water and still have it only up to your knees! A great spot for skimboarders and children to play in shallow water. We were also able to pick-up a few fun volleyball games with the locals, who were amazingly friendly. Bocce ball was also a popular activity. Since Vancouver is so north, the sun sets very late during the summer, around 9:00 p.m., and lasts for an hour, giving you many hours of sunlight to play... and a majestic sunset to finish your day. Vancouver is awesome. :) (Parking at the hotel is a little costly, but if you have a car, ask the concierge for tourist maps of the area. It makes navigating to points of interest much easier.)

Reviews.Title: “Cascadia - Good Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: rrkkjones
Reviews.Content: Gist: This is a great hotel at a good location. To give you a better perspective of this hotel, let me give you a background about us. We are a group of four, with a 27-year old daughter and an 8-year old son. We travel at least once a year, going out of the country every other year. We tend to be frugal to modest travelers, but we do splurge once in a while. Cascadia is a good hotel, and for a downtown Vancouver location was reasonable for $200 US/night for peak season. It is a hotel suite, so our room had 2 queen size beds, a sofa (not a loveseat), a fridge, a microwave, a coffee maker, a dishwasher, stove top range, and, of course, a tv. (I did ask for 2 beds.) I was at first disappointed considering I was comparing this to a hotel suite that we stayed in at Montreal a few years ago. That hotel suite was more like a mini apartment. Cascadia, on the other hand, is a hotel suite that is more like a hotel with a more room. However, my son did approve of the hotel and he said it was nice. My son has become very picky (more like "spoiled") with hotels and expects a certain standard. We have recently been staying at resort-type hotels (through timeshare purchases/exchanges) thus he expects something as nice and comfortable. So for him to say "nice" means that it is better than what he expected. We told him that it is a hotel and not like the resort-type hotels, we've been staying previously. Breakfast is free and they do provide a decent spread. Eggs, pancakes, bagels, muffins, pastries, cereals, fruits, sausages, potatoes, etc. So, having breakfast at the hotel is a good idea. They serve breakfast between 6:30 am to 9:30 a.m. We're very relaxed travelers so for the 2 days we ate at 9:00 a.m. One thing great is they do have self-service laundry (2nd floor, need your room key). $2.00 Canadian each for washer or dryer. They do sell soap and dryer liner ($2/Can). Note, the load takes $1/Can. coins, while the dryer takes quarters/Can. So have the necessary change. The front desk had some change, but not much. My husband had to go to two 7-11 stores before he got the appropriate change. This is our pre-cruise stay and having a place to do laundry before our 7-day cruise was wonderful. It cuts down the amount of clothes we bring. Note, comparing it to our washer and dryer at home, the capacity I believe is smaller. It seems you needed to dry clothes twice to be really dry. So allocate accordingly. Location: It is good, but we did use the taxi a lot. Stanley Park is walkable, though we did took a taxi going there but walked back to the hotel via interesting streets. Many places are walkable. The casino is close by (taxi $8.00/Can). Granville Island -- you can walk to the dock and take the ferry. Ferry was $3/C each with child and senior at half price. Rented bike at Denmen(?) street. For 3 hours (4 riders)/ the cost was approx. $75/Can. Area around the hotel is safe to walk around. We took a taxi to Gastown (approx. $9/C). Yaletown is walkable. Robson street walkable. Caveat: If you are walking from Gastown to Chinatown, be wary about Hastings St. [We had dinner at Old Spaghetti Factory (great food, very reasonable - approx $13/Can pasta meal, with coffee, and ice cream ($6 child meal with drink and ice cream).] We somehow stumbled near an area where the place and the people around which were a tad unpleasant. I read about this area (not all Hastings St. is bad) and there seems to be a lot of homeless and drug use. My son was so unnerved that after reaching Chinatown, he wanted to go home. He felt unsafe. (So we did not see much of Chinatown at all. Just enough to get a cab back to the hotel). Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RuthWinAZ
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our three day stay at the Cascadia. Our queen suite was spacious, nicely decorated, and airy. The breakfast buffet was very generous and varied, everything from oatmeal to granola to bagels to eggs each morning. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the location is excellent: close to public transit and to lots of interesting places. Two PCs with free internet access also were appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dandms11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia when it was a Marriott so were surprised to find it had changed hands without any notification. Not surprised it is no longer a Marriott! It is a reasonable Hotel, nothing more. The rooms are a adequate, reasonably comfortable, but noisy. The aircon/heating which sound like Concorde taking off! We could not use it when in the room. Furnishings OK if a bit tired. Staff are polite, helpful and knowledgeable. Buffet breakfast very good with a good selection of cereals, breads, juices with all the trimmings, tea and coffee. No complaints. Good location in the heart of Vancouver, but a bit far to walk to City's attractions. Trolley city tour picks up from outside as does Rocky Whistler Mountaineer. Must do's are the Trolly tours around town and to Grouse Mountain, Whistler Mountaineer train to Whistler - stay at least overnight - but come back by road or better still Seaplane! Many other attractions such as Granby Island, Gas Town, Stanley Park, whale watching, tours to Victoria and Vancouver Island.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deal Bar None in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chingo_9
Reviews.Content: The Staff are freindly and helpful the Hotel is a little dated but is clean and very LARGE ROOMS the hot tub and pool work good and courtyard is nice Best free Breakfest ever had at any hotel and Prime Rib in the resteruant was priced great and tasted excellent . BEST BANG FOR FOR BUCK OVER ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Nalama
Reviews.Content: Staff was very professional, room spotless, the location was perfect, the view spectacular, the breakfast was more that I expected, I was expecting continental breakfast but it wasn't, it was a complete menu. As for the price, it was absolutely affordable. I will go back to that same Hotel on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: practice1111
Reviews.Content: The room was more like a studio apartment with a full kitchen. Even had a dishwasher and the room service actually ran the dishwasher for you. I saved over 1/2 of the cost by using Priceline. Convenient location. Would come back again but only if I could get the same 1/2 off from Priceline. Larry

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the location, great service”
Reviews.Author: madelinoise
Reviews.Content: We did like the spaciousness of the room and the comfort of the bed. The location was great: we were able to walk to the Art Museum and Chinatown from the hotel. The service was superb we forgot an umbrella and a camera that were waiting for us at home at our return thank to the nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise; would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: upright_infinity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days in mid June. Got this hotel through priceline. For some reason I was a little worried after first getting this hotel through priceline because it was changing from a Marriot Residence Inn to this new ownership group and I thought it may be a bit rundown. But those fears were unfounded and I am happy to say that this was a really great hotel that I got for a really good price. The hotel is in a decent area and within walking distance to a lot of attractions. There is a trolley (for a fee) that stops right outside the hotel. Checkin staff was really helpful when I first arrived. I thought I was going to get a "priceline" room (usually lower floor, more beds than you need, near a high traffic area, no view, by the elevator, etc) but I got a room on one of the top floors with none of those priceline cons. The pros to the room were that it was clean (carpet, bedding, bathroom, kitchenette, sitting area, desk, balcony), quiet (no thin walls), and very large. I'm not sure if this is true of every room, but I had a small kitchenette that included a minifridge, sink, microwave, stove/oven, toaster, plates, dishwasher, counterspace, plates/utensils. I only used the fridge, but it was very convenient. I had somewhat of a view from my balcony (I could see False Creek as well as the Lookout Tower from my room) but it was ruined by the construction that was going on right in front of me. At least I did not hear any construction noises in the morning. There is complimentary breakfast which I really liked (I'm not that picky when it comes to food) that had a decent selection (eggs, sausage, potatoes, pancake/french toast, bagels, croissants, muffins, fruit, yogurts, granola, oatmeal, toast, juice, coffee, milk--some items changed, like one day pancakes, one day french toast). The have secure garage parking which was $19/day. They had free internet acess both in the room and in the lobby. There is a pool which I did not use. Minor cons to the room: the airconditioning is loud, but not untolerable (more like white noise). The faucet in the bathroom sink in my room was in an awkward position--too far from the sink, which made it kind of difficult to wash my hands. Also, the one overhead light in the bathroom was very hot. If you stand right underneath it it's like standing under a heat lamp. I'm not very tall but I could still feel how hot it was. A taller person might burn his head if he stood there for a long period of time. Kind of weird complaints, but there really wasn't much to complain about. The only other significant complaint I had was they only have partime concierge service, and the one time I did manage to talk to someone he was not that helpful. The free brocures and internet service were more useful to me. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the spacious and clean rooms, as well as the ammenities in the rooms. I would stay here again if I go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Sailingmate
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 16 month old daughter and were looking for somewhere safe, that had a kitchenette or at least a fridge/microwave to prep bottles...on a budget. Looking at many places, its hard to decide, but we loved this hotel. We stayed in a superior suite (queen bed, full kitchen) on the 16th floor looking west. Not much of a view, but sunny. The only complaint would be that the tiles in the shower were dated, but all in all, very nice and all was clean. They didn't charge us for the crib, which was very nice. The hot buffet breakfast is self-serve and was overwhelming: oatmeal option with raisins, shaved coconut, granola; toast/english muffins; waffle makers one day; 3 kinds of yogurt with granola and fresh fruit; pastries; bananas, apples to take away; scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausages/patties, pancakes or french toast; juices and coffee/tea. Easily, we saved $25 each day filling up so that we didn't need to buy lunch. The pool was a bit chilly, but the hottub was nice. We used the laundry facilities, but instead of paying $2 for soap from the dispenser, walk across the street to the 7-11, its only .99! Great to have large capacity washer/dryer right there, we did our clothes over breakfast! Try the Milwaukee creamery one block towards the water; AMAZING custard icecream! Ferry to Granville Island is 4 blocks downhill and links to the seawall walk and is about 10-15 minutes to walk to English Bay. Quite safe area, lots of access to public transit routes, just go to the website and trip plan from your address! We took the #2 to the #19 and were in Stanley Park within 30 minutes. Also, great place to rent bikes on Denman St., near Robson about 1 block up from "spokes" which is on the corner of Denman and Georgia. Spokes was 2x the price of the store we went to (paid $45 for 2 mountain bikes and a chariot for 5 hours)! Go through Stanley Park and stop when you like. Advice: pick up sandwiches, water and snacks before as there aren't many places to find them in the park without paying a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Cascadia has everything!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Tex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver for 4 nights and found a deal on the tourism Vancouver website. The Cascadia rooms have a fridge, stove, microwave, coffee maker, couch, etc. They are larger than average hotel rooms, but similarly price. They had both wired and wireless internet. The wired internet is about 10X as fast. The beds are soft and comfortable and the bathrooms are about average. The rooms aren't overly fancy, but if are nice enough. The pool and hot tub are mediocre. The pool is small, the hot tub is fairly standard, but they're better than not having a pool or hot tub. The buffet breakfast is fantastic. Despite being out late most nights we'd wake up just for the breakfast which included, scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, french toast or pancakes, various fruits, oatmeal, cereal, juices, yogurt, etc. After breakfast we'd hop back into bed to recover a bit more. The location is pretty great. It's not directly in the heart of downtown, but it's only a 5-minutes walk. It's also only a 5-minute walk to the Seabus that takes you to Granville Island. The staff at the front desk was incredible, especially Amanda, who was more than happy to request restaurants for lunch and dinner. We liked it so much we stayed one more night! The

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LorneOKB
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this hotel. We booked a Deluxe King with full kitchen (which we never used) and large balcony. Room had a very comfy king bed, excellent pillows, wireless and wired internet and great view from the rather large balcony. Full breakfast was a major bonus. Hop-on-hop off tour buses and trolleys stop right at the door. Although I won't be returning to Vancouver for a holiday again (large noisy ugly concrete jungle) I would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaycouplecanada
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vancouver and were a bit nervous about finding a good hotel. We were very fortunate by choosing the Cascadia. The rooms were big and clean. The location was in a safe area and within walking distance to a variety of restaurants. The breakfast every morning was fantastic as we had a long day ahead of us. Overall we made a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable and large room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MagsHeartsVacay
Reviews.Content: This is what I liked about this hotel: 1. Location: Not being very familiar with Vancouver, I trusted a friend who told me this location was central. I originally was looking for something closer to Robson but in hindsight, I thought this location was even better. It is only about 4 or 5 blocks from Robson. And in Vancouver, it is a joy to walk. It is also only 3 or 4 blocks to the Aquatic Centre where ferries and water taxis can take you to mulitple destinates including Granville Market. One night, we were tired and wanted to bring food back. I took a walk down Davie St. (hotel is between Davie and Drake) and within 2 blocks in the colorful neighborhood known as the West End, I had my choice of Vietnamese, Japanese, Hamburgers, Greek, Chinese, etc. All this is close enough to be convenient but far enough to not be noise problem. I think Vancouver's public transit works really well. And many of the buses we needed ran down Howe St. street which was the next street over. 2. Value: I found this hotel using TripAdvisor and booked it through United to take advantage of frequent flyer miles. But whatever site you use, the rates are very, very reasonable. For the location, the number of people one room can sleep (4 in our case), and the level of comfort, you cannot beat the price. And internet access is free! Oh and all-you-can-eat breakfast included! 3. Comfort: The room was big. It had 2 queen size beds, a desk for my laptop and a little sofa. It was me, my mom and my mother-in-law. We never felt cramped or uncomfortable. In the little kitchen, there is everything you need to make food in the room should you decide that over eating out. The beds were very comfortable and I slept well. 4. Breakfast: While it is by no means gourmet, it was very satisfying. Yogurt, granola, sausage, french toast on some days, pancake on others, potatoes. Oatmeal for us health nuts with fixins'. And some pastries and fruit. The eggs were delicious. I couldn't eat enough of their scrambled eggs! My one suggestion for this hotel is that they hire another bellhop. The one bellhop I saw was working his butt off but while he was putting luggage away or delivering something, there was no one to help waiting guests. Overall, I loved this hotel for its proximity to places we wanted to visit and access to public transit. I will definitely stay here again shall I have the pleasure of returning to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and great location but NOISY!!!”
Reviews.Author: signyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well run and well situated. The rooms are nice as is the service. It is well priced and offered an excellent experience except .... it was very noisy!!!!! This is a huge issue that for this hotel cannot be resolved. My room and my colleague's room both faced the back of the hotel (south, facing opposite the entrance) on the 17th and 12th floors respectively. We were kept awake by street noise likely coming from disco patrons (we are both from NYC so don't mind cars, horns etc - but yelling and general cackling are a different story). Also there is a building being constructed 100-200 feet from the window, so noise from construction starts at 7:30 am and is loud enough. Bottom line, if you're a good sleeper, get in very late, wake up earlier than 7:30 (and are out of the hotel until late afternoon), or get a room facing front, this is a worthwhile hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: EJPMontreal
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to find a better deal in downtown Vancouver. This very comfortable suites-hotel is well-located in the Downtown area of Yaletown, near the Granville Bridge, within reasonable walking distance of everything. It has a courteous, helpful staff, clean & comfortable rooms with small kitchenette, free internet service and includes a good, warm breakfast every morning. Their free luggage storage service is very convenient for cruisers. Jenny & Emilio, Montréal

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Mellko
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel in Vancouver (it's the old Marriott Residence Inn re-branded). My husband was taking a course on Granville Island and I wanted to shop. The hotel is perfectly situated for both. It is a mere five minute walk to the little Granville Island passenger ferry ($3 a ride) which saves the tremendous headache of trying to find a place to park on the Island and it is also easily accessible to walking in downtown Vancouver - about a 15 minute stroll from the hotel to Gastown. The rooms were very clean and our room in the 18th floor had a king-sized bed, small kitchen and balcony and quite affordable comparatively speaking to other downtown hotels. We paid extra for the king-sized bed suite but not a whole lot extra. The view was looking over to the Burrard Bridge and English Bay. Considering we were in downtown Vancouver, the room was amazingly quiet as well. The hotel has a small workout room, a nice sized pool and a great hot tub. A great hot breakfast is included, they even have a funky waffle maker that allows you to make your own waffles. Best of all, the water pressure was good so you can have a great shower in the morning and the pillows aren't too flat or puffy! I would strongly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Teddy5401
Reviews.Content: I experienced a very pleasant stay at the Cascadia. I was particularly well cared for by the Food and Beverage Manager. The free breakfst is amazing, and the Mi Bar & grill is awesome! I was also very surprised by how quiet it was, in spite of being in the heart of Vancouver's shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal--Will definently stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyx654
Reviews.Content: What caught my eye about Cascadia when looking for a place to stay for Spring Break was the free breakfest and low cost for the room ($80/night in American). I'm from Oregon where there are no sales or food taxes, so it was really surprising for me how much food ended up costing in Canada with the seemingly endless taxes. The free breakfest ended up saving my boyfriend and I a lot of money. It's not just a continental-type breakfest either, there's coffee, juice, and tea stations, pancakes, waffles, bacon, different cereals, oatmeal, parfaits, eggs, etc.... The room I booked was great too, very spacious, free internet, full kitchen, everything was clean, the bed was comfy with some great blankets. The hotel is also pretty close to most areas of attractions, such as yaletown, so it is a great place for people who like to walk. Other areas, such as Chinatown, I would recommend taking a taxi or bus. The restaurant didn't have much of a selection, but the food was great and the servers hilarious. Parking was a little high, $19/day in Canadian, but secure with there being two gates to the parking area that could only be opened with one's keycard. The hotel does let you park until 6pm of your checkout day though. The only complaint I really have about this hotel was the lack of selection in room service. My boyfriend got sick one night and we ordered room service, the menu only having I believe five or so items. I would definently recommend this place for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for our Vancouver Vacation”
Reviews.Author: allywooo
Reviews.Content: I looked very hard online for a really great hotel for our 5 day trip to Vancouver and finally choose the Cascadia Suites. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted in a friendly manner by the front desk staff. Check in was easy and efficient. When we got up to our room I was surprised however to see that the room wasn`t quite what I was hoping for. The room in my opinion wasn`t what I would classify as a superior suite like I had booked. It was much smaller than I pictured and the bedroom and living room were only separated by half a wall. The first night that we were there the toilet had overflowed. However maintenance came up right away to fix it. Most of the staff were extremely friendly during our stay. The breakfast was great, and that`s saying something since we`re not really breakfast people! Their restaurant was alright and eventually our room did grow on me and had a great view! Great location too! We were close to everything and I felt very safe there (since you needed your key card to access the elevator) Overall there might have been a couple of hiccups but it was a very nice stay nonetheless and I would recommend it to other vacationers

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Vancouver these days”
Reviews.Author: YVRvisitor
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Vancouver and this was my best stay in years. The Cascadia staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms was spacious and bright. The kitchenette was well-stocked. The breakfast buffet (included in room rate) was the best thing about the stay... a delightful display every morning of healthy options (granola, fruit, yogurt, juice), plus lots of eggs, muffins, pancakes, syrup, etc. for the high-carb days. I stayed 10 days and had my best visit ever to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem at an impressive rate!”
Reviews.Author: luna8691
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that I was disappointed that this was no longer a Marriot Residence. But the Silver Birch hotel line impressed me and my 12 yr old nephew! The staff and service was excellent. The room was spacious, clean and fully equipped. The hot breakfast buffet satisfied us both, and the pool/hot tub/gym was more than sufficient. We had no problem with an early check in and a late check out, at no additional cost. My complaint of noisy neighbours was dealt with efficiently and without further problems. Only a 10 minute walk to Robson and close to bus routes, etc. Excellent location for restaurants and entertainment. Vancouver is in the construction boom, but the noise is manageable during the day. The bathroom grouting and sink could use a minor repair. $97.00/night at hotels.ca, Parking in hotel SECURE parkade is $19.00/night.

Reviews.Title: “This is no longer a Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndieCA
Reviews.Content: A client of mine prefers to put their employees in this location but upon calling them today to book a room we found out that as of February 23rd this location was sold to a private owner and is no longer part of the Marriott chain. Sad news.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves a higher rating”
Reviews.Author: lbeachbum
