Reviews.Content: There's obviously a lot of competition as this hotel is very good. In any other town it would have a much higher rating than No. 51. We had a spacious suite on a high floor with a great view. The suite was well appointed and very clean. Breakfast was good, and kept you satisfied for a day of sightseeing. The hot choices alternated so you get some variety. The location is good, with all to see in dowtown Vancouver an easy walk away. Great tapas restaurant 'La Bodega' just around the corner. Also, lots of restaurants and bars in Yaletown just a couple of blocks walk. The number of homeless people in the dowtown area is quite confronting, but we always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: piet10
Reviews.Content: Marriott Residence Inn Vancouver This is the worst Marriott I have ever stayed Inn. At check-in (done through Travelocity), they had me down for a queen size bed. I ordered two beds. Finally, they rudely gave us a studio, & I had wanted a suite. The room was noisy & poorly furnished, There was a gay bar just under our window, with noise all night. There was no hot water. The refrigerator was tiny & unusable. The Air Conditioning did not work. The Wi-fi was meant to be free, but it is $12.99. The room was filthy & there was a cockroach in the coffee maker. All in all, a ruined vacation. Stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “They will treat you well!”
Reviews.Author: bayoupots
Reviews.Content: First time to Vancouver. Obtained our room at a rate of $100 through priceline. The reviews on Tripadvisor were mixed but we were very pleasantly surprised. Was just staying for one Fri. night and had a great experience. Arrived before check-in but they let us check our bags in so we would not have to leave them in our car. They got our phone number so they could call us as soon as a room was available, as we wanted to walk around--and they did call us before check-in time. Felt very safe walking in the area in the daytime. Hotel was clean and we had a spacious, comfortable room on the 12th floor with even a dishwasher. The room overlooked the front of the hotel and while it was not a particularly beautiful view, there was a lot of light and one could see much of the downtown area. Best of all, the desk clerks were all very helpful, especially Jennifer, who was very friendly and sweet and was so informative. She would make restaurant suggestions and would even call reservations. It was like staying in a big B& B in the middle of the city since we felt very taken care of. Breakfast buffet was filling and good variety of foods. Only negative was the high parking rate of about $22 but the positives outweighed this and we would return to Residence Inn again---good location.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Downtown Jail”
Reviews.Author: BigdSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Our Rooms were not ready for us at check in time--staff problems. Security was obviously a problem for this hotel as we had to swipe cards for everything in the hotel. two seprate swipes to park your car. You had to swipe your card to use the lift and for each floor wanted.Swipe your card for breakfast. Swipe your card to get to your room. On complaining about the room reception said they would be up right away to sort out the problem. 15 minutes later they had still not arrived and on being chased they said they were just on their way up. They must have had swiping problems as it took them 15 further minutes for them to arrive. Still they changed our room to a room where wires were broken and there was a cracked sink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, room, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: abucklin
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband, aunt, aunt's friends and her sister traveled to Vancouver early for an Alaska cruise. I originally reserved two rooms on priceline and got the Residence Inn Downtown for $135 per night/ per room. I thought this was a bargin based on the location and also that the rooms are all suites! We arrived late on Thursday, August 28th and the person checking us in had the keys and room assignments ready to go. My husband and I had a room on the 8th floor looking out on the city with a nice view. We could hear the nightclub across the street and see people coming in and out of it, but it wasn't very load and didn't bother us. Overall, the room was perfect - spacious with a comfortable queen bed, sofa, kitchen, and regular sized bathroom. During our two night stay, we took avantage of the excellent location - walking distance to Robson St (for shopping) as well as various other locations. We walked everywhere - all through downtown as well as along the water by the Canada Place cruise ship terminal. Our friends enjoyed the trolley tour as it stopped close to our hotel. The breakfast was very god and we enjoyed it the day of our departure on Saturday morning. They do have an early checkout (11:00 am). I thought it was early. We didn't leave until 12:00 and had no problem getting a taxi out front to take us to our cruise ship at Ballntyne Pier. The cruise was amazing and we loved Vancouver as well. I am sure my husband and I will be back and I would be happy staying at the Residence Inn once again if it was awarded to me on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location. Bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: FlipMap
Reviews.Content: Bad experience at this hotel. The parking garage is sketchy and not well patrolled. Don't bring your car if you plan to stay here. There are long-term residents that stay here and stay up at all hours of the night partying and cooking horrible-smelling food that creep into the adjacent rooms (e.g. curry smelling food). Despite my horrible one night stay here, I have to say that the people that work here give good customer service. At least they gave me that much considering I had such a bad experience; but the management wouldn't even give me more points or to make it up to me for my next stay with the Marriott. I will never stay at this particular hotel again. Not worth the rate we paid for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: rabocse
Reviews.Content: Pros: +Clean rooms equipped with a small kitchenette, coffeemaker & refrigerator (always a must in our family!) +Beds with fluffy pillows were truly comfortable. +Walking distance to Robson St. (shopping, shopping!!!) +Breakfast buffet was fabulous and plentiful! +Pool was enjoyed immensely by our teens +Thai restaurant nearby served good food +7-11 convenience store across the street (perfect for buying afternoon snacks especially when you've got teens) Cons: -Parking price steep -Construction behind hotel. Seems like there's major construction everywhere in downtown Vancouver. -Pool somewhat crowded Otherwise, would come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast buffet and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. We stayed there one night, prior to boarding a cruise ship for a 7 night Northbound Cruise to Alaska. We checked in just before midnight, hence there weren't any lines. We had two adjoining rooms which both had a kitchen for in room dining. The rooms were well appointed with a sofa and two beds. The best part about the stay was their complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning. They had a variety of hot and cold dishes, ranging from eggs and waffles to some of the best chocolate long john donuts we have ever tasted. We frequently stay at Residence Inns and Fairfield Inns and this was by far the best breakfast offering we have ever seen. A similar breakfast at a local restaurant would likely be $15 per person. There are very few downsides to the hotel, but I do have to mention that the elevators took an extremely long time to come, on average 5-7 minutes. We're young and moderately active, so we found ourselves using the stairs the majority of the time. The only other disappointment was some misinformation from the hotel concierge. He quoted us only 10 to 15 minutes to walk to Stanley Park. This walk took at least 45 minutes, and more along the lines of 75 minutes to get to the main totem pole area of the park. Because it took so long we ended up having to take taxis back to the hotel so that we didn't miss their 11am checkout rule. All in all though, it was a fantastic hotel and we would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: joanslade
Reviews.Content: Good position,half hour walk from cruise terminal.Very well appointed rooms with fridge,dishwasher,toaster,oven and general kitchen utensils.Large room with 3 seater settee,very comfortable queen beds.Some reception staff rather surly and off hand.Hotel used extensively by the big tour companies.There is extensive very loud construction work on two sides of the hotel from 0730 to about 1730 on weekdays and by the look of it this is set to continue for a long time.There is also muted disco boom boom music from a nearby disco until about 3 or 4 in the morning.Breakfast very good.Small nice pool in garden setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: C.petersen
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and had a great little kitchenette. The beds were very comfy with lots of pillows both feather and sponge. There was a delightful cafe for dinner and lunches and the inclusive breakfast was a large buffet with eggs, pancakes or french toast, hasbrowns and every imaginable continental-style choice you could possibly desire. Help yourself to as much juice, tea or coffee as you like. The price was very good value...would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it is”
Reviews.Author: unplainjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn for business for a few days. It was fine. Nothing special. But clean and safe. There is free internet which was good. The breakfast was very large but quality was just okay. Front desk staff were nice but I had a couple of requests that were never fulfilled. I forgot to bring toothpaste and I requested it twice. Once at the front desk and later called from my room. Through my whole stay they never brought me up any even though they said they would. Also I requested a wake up call and they didn't call me. Same thing happened to my colleague. Request a room facing the front of the hotel as I was facing the back and which looks onto very noisy daytime construction. Convenient location though. This hotel is fine for business or family trips but I wouldn't necessarily recommend it for couples on a romantic getaway or for a luxury stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, rest a bit shabby, and noisy”
Reviews.Author: other1
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the staff - all were extremely friendly keeping up the good name of Canadian service. The hotel itself is tired, a bit dirty and freyed around the edges. It's just franchisee under-investment, that experienced travelers will recognise along with the musty smell: Room "kitchens" (bedsit style) look like they haven't been updated in 15-20 years, & the bathrooms maybe 3 years younger. Despite possibly the largest/clunkiest head known to man, the shower trickles luke warm. Rattling a/c, etc, etc, Breakfast is big on the ubiquitous american sugary junk - waffles, multicoloured cheerios, doughnuts, plus the usual rubbery scrambled eggs, a few implausibly sized glazed apples, and some melon. The main issue is the noisy lifts (or "elevators" for you americans) which ding so loudly on each floor they can easily keep you awake and you can even hear them coming from 4 floor floors away (they ding on your floor just in passing - regardless of whether the door opens). Such things are normally trivial since a move away from the lifts usually means you can get some sleep. Not here though - even around the corner the lifts ding so loudly an frequently that they pose a constant irritation. 1234 Hornby is not a particularly useful address for handy access to anything much. There's a 7-eleven across the street but no decent food unless own-brand subs are your thing.

Reviews.Title: “one of vancouver's best hotels”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: My work sees me frequent Vancouver city centre hotels frequently, and I have stayed in most hotels in the area. This hotel is very well maintained, has large functional well appointed rooms, a very good complimentary breakfast, a professional and cheerful staff, and is spotless. The kitchen area even has a dishwasher!! The only slight downside would be the location, which is a 5 minute walk from Robson St. however only 5 minutes the other way has you on the seafront walkway. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: wellardn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in September and most impressed on both occassions. Rooms clean, large and with well equipped kitchenette. Complimentary breakfast OK but more suited to North American tastes than to ours. The patio area outside the dining room for breakfast much appreciated by smokers (like me). Otherwise entire hotel is non-smoking. We had no problems with noise (in front rooms on both occassions)but some friends staying in back rooms complained about noise from nightclub. Hotel rates seem to be very variable depending on how you book. Would certainly go back again. Vancouver is a beutifuly city. Only downside we found was the number of beggars in the CBD streets, more numerous now than in asian cities like Bangkok or Jakarta (and more aggressive).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel w/ in room kitchen and extra pull out bed - nice for a family”
Reviews.Author: teddyf
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and researched tripadvisor before booking a hotel in Downtown Vancouver. Our goal was to find something moderately priced (approx $200.00) in the downtown area that was famly friendly. This hotel is in an ok location but a walkable distance to the center of downtown and near the easy to use bus line. Next door is a medical center for low income people and there were some not-so-savory characters near their doors. The hotel, though, was very clean, friendly service, had a pool open until 11pm and a nice kitchenette area in the room where you could reheat food or make a light meal. Also a grill for guest use outside. Given the price and extra space that comes with this type of hotel, we would stay here again when travelling with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, service - mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: Tiamaria865
Reviews.Content: We had a corporate rate at this hotel that couldn't be beat, but as first time visitors to Vancouver and only 24 hours to see the city, I would recommend staying in one of the trendier, more scenic locations in the city. The staff was EXCELLENT. I don't think I have ever met a friendlier staff at a hotel. This hotel has the customer service down like no other. Crystal was the person who gave us directions from the highway and checked us in when we arrived. She also called up about twenty minutes after we got to our room to ask us if we were satisfied or needed anything else. This room was a King/non-smoking (the whole facility is non-smoking, I believe). It had a fully-stocked little kitchen, comfortable bed/bedding, and was very spacious. The only thing I did not enjoy about our room was the view. We looked out the front of the hotel and it was just sort of junky and "felt" unsafe, although I think it is a safe area. We left the hotel in the late afternoon and walked all over the city - eventually taking a cab back, so I don't know what the immediate area is like for nightlife (also, it was a Monday night). If you are looking for a long-term stay, the Residence Inns are always a good choice, but for a one-nighter, I would stay somewhere else and just spend the bucks for a view of the water.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: beckyras
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on the room, $128/night. The breakfast was good, much better than cereal and rolls. The staff was friendly and helpful. We called housekeeping for more towels and they were up at the room within 5 minutes. I then could not find the sheets to make up the fold out, they were up again in 5 minutes and were very patient with me (the sheets were in the closet the whole time!). The hotel is centrally located, different things in different directions. We did walk alot, but we enjoy walking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sazzle_Mac_Dazzle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 020807-050807 at the start of our Rocky Mountaineer holiday. We thought the hotel was excellent value. The room was nice and big with all ammenities you could want, in fact a full kitchenette - cooker, dishwasher, microwave etc although we ate out. Lounge area with double sofa, desk and the telly and two large queen size beds. The bathroom was clean and tidy and plenty of towels including ones down at the pool area. The pool and whirlpool were excellent and on 2 occassions I was the only person in the pool. They have a nice patio area off the room they serve breakfast in which is good for us smokers as you can take you morning drink out there and not feel completely isolated although the rest of the hotel is strictly no smoking. The breakfast was delicious - could have stayed eating it all day.... Emma on the concierge desk was outstanding and helped us book a budget trip to Victoria to go whale watching - of which we saw 3 pods about 10 whales in total. She was not bothered about helping with the public transport aspect to save us money rather than going all in on a package day trip. In fact she organised the Pacific Line coach that collects from hotels. Only down side - view from the bedroom window - as attached was a building site and a night club along with quite noisy aircon which had to be switched off while you slept. Then again no more noisy than any other city we have stayed in. The reception staff were really friendly and very helpful. Overall and really excellent stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some good and some bad.”
Reviews.Author: J-Lvs-2Travel
Reviews.Content: I'm from Colorado and was on this trip with my 2 daughters, ages 17 and 21. We'd never been to Vancouver and thought it would be fun to visit there. We were on vacation that also included stops in Seattle to visit family and then San Francisco. Vancouver was the first stop. First the bad... I booked this hotel through Hotels.com. Never again! I have come to believe, after having done this before, that when you arrive, the hotels give you the crappiest rooms they have. I will never use Hotels.com again. One hotel in NYC charged me more to move rooms after we found the bed was too short for my 6'3" friend. This time, at the Residence Inn, I was given a room that had mold growing on the air vent. I didn't notice it though until the following morning when I woke up very sick. I was previously feeling great, but I am allergic to mold so this was a huge problem. I called the front desk to complan and they first said that all the vents were recently cleaned. I said they must have missed this room. So, then they said they would gladly move me. The next room also had mold on the vent. I called the front desk again. This time, they sent over a janitor. I showed him the problem and watched as he wiped off the mold. I told him this was not how you "kill" mold. I explained it had to be soaked or sprayed with a 10% bleach to 90% water solution to actually kill the mold. He took it away and half an hour later, it was clean. I smelled it to be sure he's really used bleach, and he had. I then went down to the front desk and spoke to the manager on duty and several of the front desk clerks over heard us. He credited me 1 of the 4 nights of our stay. He also instructed the clerks to make sure anything I wanted from the restaurant would be "free of charge". However, when I got the bill, this was not the case, even though one of the clerks who had heard this conversation was there when I checked out. The manager though was not. She denied she had herad him say this. I had no witnesses of my own to back me up so I let it go. She did credit me for 2 movies though since I had to stay in the hotel when I should have been out enjoying the city more. Other than that, the only compalint I have is the breakfast. It was the same every morning and only so-so. And now the good... The gym was ok. Never tried the pool or hot tub. Too many others were using it when we went down there. Besides, we were not in Vancouver to go to the gym or go swimming. However, my older daughter found a Pilates class down the street one morning that she enjoyed. The restaurant downstairs has very good food, though the kitchen was a little slow one night. The mixed drinks were strong though, so can't complain. And due to the slowness, they gave us free desserts. When we ordered room service, which we did a couple of times because I was too sick to leave and thought it was all going to be free, the food was good and it arrived in a timely manner. The front desk clerks were very helpful in recommending where to go and how to get places without taking the car. I also really appreciated the umbrellas that were in our room because it rained every day of our trip, though only for a few hours and not that hard. Make sure you head over to Granville Island for some unique (but pricey) gifts and things. I'm an artist so I really loved this. Too bad we didn't go earlier in the day though as the shops all closed by 6ish. We stayed and went to the Comedy Theater in the evening for an audience participation show. That was fun! The Farmer's Market was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Good location for exploring Granville Island, Yaletown, English Bay”
Reviews.Author: RenSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at this Marriott and the room was good-sized (2-queens), very clean, updated with good amenities (includes utility kitchen). Breakfast included was great with lots of options hot and cold. The location was not in the prime tourist areas, but within walking distance of Granville Island, Yaletown and English Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cookie32Texas
Reviews.Content: Considering the fact that I paid around $150 to stay here with my family, I expected a much larger room. We've stayed at a lot of Residence Inns and this one had pretty small rooms. On the other hand, the view from the balcony was fantastic and the indoor pool was a plus, as well. Staying anywhere in downtown Vancouver is expensive, so I guess $150 wasn't that bad of a price. I just wish the rooms were bigger than they were. I felt like everything was crammed into a much smaller area than they were meant to be. The kitchen was also smaller than other Residence Inns I've seen. Overall, I'd say if you are dead set on staying in the downtown area, this is a nice place to do so. Otherwise, you'll save a few bucks by staying near the airport in Richmond or even in North Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not particularly special”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott properties about 150 nights a year for work, and visit many Residence Inns due to the home-like amenities and set-up of the rooms. I have stayed at this hotel on a couple occasions and found it to be adequate. The rooms recently got new carpeting and bedding, although for some reason even the new Marriott upgraded bedding seemed surprisingly thin and cheap at this one. The kitchens and bathrooms in the rooms are dated in my opinion, and very 80's. The tile in the shower looks like a candidate project for one of those home makeover shows. The rooms do have a great view and were clean and the service great at the front desk. I would stay here again but don't expect the amenties of a brand new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendly and a good location”
Reviews.Author: 3CsFamilyTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over our 6-year old daughter's spring break from school. While all the construction outside was a bother, the entire city is experiencing that in preparation for the 2010 olympics. They didn't start until 8:00, so as long as we didn't mind not sleeping in we were fine with the window closed. We checked in on Easter Sunday, and as we had an early flight were very pleased that they had a room available for us at 11:30 am instead of having to wait until normal check-in time. The room was very clean and the studio kitchen was fine for what cooking we wanted to do. The staff of the hotel was top notch. The front desk folks were extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge was a wealth of information and had good discounts on tickets to a variety of attractions. We didn't need a car for our entire stay. There are two ferry boat companies within easy walking distance of the hotel (even for a 6-year old) that took us to Granville Island, Vanier Park (where the Space Museum/Planetarium and the Maritime Museum are) and down to the Science Museum. City buses are also close by. The staff will do grocery shopping for you for no additional charge, though there are stores within a few blocks. No shortage of restaurants either. While we didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, the menu looked great. The bar area was nice and the staff very friendly. The morning buffet provided plenty of variety, but it is the same items every day. We didn't make it to any of the evening munchy hours. The indoor pool was great and while there were people using it regularly, it was never crowded. It was a bummer that the jacuzzi was broken for the first couple of days. While the view from our window wasn't anything to get excited about, the local area is safe and the central location was super. The Vancouver Trolley does make a stop at the hotel, as does the Stanley Park Shuttle while it is in season. All in all a great place to stay in Vancouver if you want to do some exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Vancouver great!”
Reviews.Author: PittGrrl04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn by Marriott for 4 nights in February (over President's Day Weekend and Chinese New Year). We were in Vancouver for a conference that took place in the hotel, and were pleasantly surprised by the rooms, location of the hotel, and the service. First of all, every staff member we encountered during the weekend was so friendly and helpful, more so than most hotels I've visited. The hotel is located near Davie St. and a few blocks away from Robson St., which is a great location. There are so many restaurants, shops, and local flavor within walking distance that we didn't have to take a cab anywhere (except the airport upon our departure)! The hotel has its own restaurant and bar, which looked small, but very nice (although we did not eat there at all). We stayed in a room on the 17th floor, and the view was awesome! Our room had a walk-out balcony (with 2 chairs) that overlooked the city, the harbor, and the nearby mountains. The room itself has a standard but clean bathroom, comfortable bed, a sitting area, and a kitchenette. It was quite spacious. The kitchenette was especially convenient- it had a stove/oven, microwave, sink, diswasher, coffee pot, and all the plates/cups/utensils you would need to cook a decent meal. The hotel will even take your grocery list and go shopping for you- just for the cost of the food! There was also a nice assortment of coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and microwave popcorn. The meeting and banquet facilities were nice, as well as the food we were served at the conference. I would highly recommend this location for groups that need a meeting area. One day our room didn't get cleaned until after 1PM, which was a little annoying (since I like to take an afternoon nap sometimes), but other than that, I have no complaints about the hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: knightfamily44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Christmas and we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were spacious and the kitchenette was stocked with all the things needed. The pool was nice for the kids and the complimentary breakfast was awesome! The best thing about it was just how clean and comfortable the rooms were. I am picky when it comes to hotels, and this far exceeded my expatiations. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLondon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great character. We were upgraded to a harbour view room, which had great views day and night. We particularly enjoyed watching the sea planes taking off and landing. Top class swimming pool and spa pool. Breakfast was not included in the price we paid for our room (not unusual in Canada), but there are plenty of reasonably priced cafes nearby. The rotating restuarant at the top of the hotel is well worth a visit - great range of cocktails and interesting views - we were surprised how well priced both the drinks and food were (service was very, very slow though).

HotelInfo.Name: Cascadia Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1234 Hornby Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 1W5, Canada (Formerly Residence Inn)
